name: Alfredo Sauce
description: A alfredo sauce recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: After the cashews have soaked overnight (or at least 6 hours), drain and rinse them.
Add the cashews and all other ingredients to a high-powered blend and blend until smooth.
Use immediately in a recipe or store in a sealed container in the fridge.
* The recipe makes approximately 1 cup of sauce.

name: Ann’s Mushroom Gravy
description: A ann’s mushroom gravy recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: oat flour or whole wheat flour
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste

directions: In a medium pan over medium-high heat, cook the onion. Allow the onion to brown a little while stirring, adding a splash of water to the pan if it starts to burn.
Add the garlic and mushrooms and continue cooking until the mushrooms soften, again adding a little water as needed to keep the mixture from burning.
Add 1 cup of the broth to the pan and stir.
In a small bowl, combine the remaining 1 cup of broth with the miso, tamari, and flour (if using), and stir until the miso has dissolved.
Add the miso mixture to the pan. Continue cooking until the gravy thickens to your liking.
If you want a smooth gravy, transfer to a high speed blender and blend until smooth
Season with pepper to taste. Serve warm.

name: Apple Fritters
description: A apple fritters recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: large apples, peeled, cored, and diced very small

directions: 2. 3. 4. 5. 6. 7. 8. Set your oven to 375°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat.
In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the whole wheat flour, baking powder, baking soda, Ceylon
cinnamon, and nutmeg.
In a separate bowl, mix the applesauce, date paste, vanilla powder, and plant milk until smooth.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Fold in the diced apple.
Drop small balls of dough (about 3 tablespoons each) onto the prepared baking sheet using a spoon or
cookie scoop. Leave space between them as they will expand slightly.
Bake for 15-18 minutes or until the fritters are firm to the touch and lightly golden. Let them cool on the
baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack.
Mix the date paste, almond butter or tahini, plant milk, and vanilla powder until smooth and pourable in
a small bowl. Add more plant milk if needed.
Once the fritters have cooled slightly, drizzle or brush the glaze over the top. Let the glaze set for a few
minutes before serving.
Snowball Cookies
By: The Jaroudi Family
Makes one dozen
Ingredients:
1 cup oat flour
1/2 cup almond flour
1/4 cup date paste
1/4 cup unsweetened applesauce
1 tsp vanilla powder
1/4 tsp almond essence/extract (optional)
1/4 cup date sugar/powder*
You want a fine date sugar to dust these cookies to represent the classic snowball cookie. (The Well Your
World date sugar is PERFECT for this!)
2. 3. 4. 5. 6. Preheat your oven to 350°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat.
In a medium bowl, combine oat flour, almond flour, and vanilla. Mix well. In a separate small bowl,
whisk together date paste, applesauce, and almond essence/extract (if using).
Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, stirring until a soft dough forms. The dough
should be firm but pliable. If too sticky, add a small amount of oat flour.
Scoop about 2-3 tablespoons of dough and roll it into a ball. Place on the prepared baking sheet, leaving
some space between each cookie. Repeat until all dough is used.
Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the cookies are set but not browned. Allow them
to cool for 10 minutes on the baking sheet before handling.
While the cookies are still slightly warm, roll them in the date sugar to coat evenly. Place them on a wire
rack to cool completely. Roll a second time in date sugar for an extra snowy effect, if desired.
Ferrero Rocher
By: The Jaroudi Family
Makes one dozen
Ingredients:
Chocolate Hazelnut Center:
12 whole hazelnuts, raw
1 cup hazelnut butter
3 Tbsp date paste
2 Tbsp cacao powder
Chocolate Coating:
1 cup unsweetened dark chocolate, melted
2 Tbsp date paste
1 tsp vanilla powder
Crushed Coating:
1/2 cup finely chopped hazelnuts
or crushed toasted rolled oats
2. 3. 4. 5. 6. Mix hazelnut butter, date paste, and cacao powder in a bowl until well combined and slightly firm. Chill
in the fridge for 10-15 minutes to make the mixture easier to handle.
Take a small spoonful of the mixture and wrap it around one whole hazelnut to form a ball. Repeat for
all 12 hazelnuts. Place the balls on a parchment-lined tray and freeze for 40 minutes.
Melt the unsweetened dark chocolate in a double boiler or microwave. Stir in date paste and vanilla
powder until smooth.
Remove the hazelnut balls from the freezer. Dip each ball into the melted chocolate, ensuring it's fully
Roll each coated ball in the crushed hazelnuts (or oats) to form the final layer.
Place the coated balls back on the parchment-lined tray. Let them set in the fridge for at least 30 minutes
or until the chocolate hardens.
Banana Bread Whoopie Pies
By: The Jaroudi Family
Makes one dozen
Ingredients:
Whoopie Pies:
2 ripe bananas, mashed
1 1/2 cups oat flour*
1/3 cup unsweetened applesauce
1/4 cup date paste
1 tsp vanilla powder
1 tsp baking powder
1/2 tsp baking soda
1 tsp Ceylon cinnamon
1/4 tsp nutmeg
Cream Filling:
1 cup silken tofu
1/4 cup raw cashews
1/4 cup unsweetened plant milk
2 Tbsp date paste
1 tsp vanilla powder
1 Tbsp lemon juice
Notes: You can use any flour for this recipe.
2. 3. 4. 5. 6. 7. 8. Preheat oven to 350°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat.
In a mixing bowl, combine mashed bananas, date paste, and applesauce.
In another bowl, mix oat flour, baking powder, baking soda, vanilla powder, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
Gradually fold the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients until well combined.
Scoop the batter (about 3 tablespoons per cookie) onto the prepared baking sheet, flatten, and leaving
space between each.
Bake for 12–15 minutes, or until firm and lightly golden. Cool completely before assembling.
Cream Filling: Blend all ingredients in a high-speed blender until smooth and creamy. Chill in the
refrigerator for at least 1 hour to thicken.
Once the banana bread cookies are cool, spread or pipe a generous layer of the white cream filling onto
the flat side of one cookie.
Top with another cookie, pressing gently to form a sandwich.
Repeat with the remaining cookies and filling
Chewy Chocolate Cookie
By: The Jaroudi Family
Makes one dozen
Ingredients:
1 1/2 cup oat flour
1/2 cup unsweetened plant milk
1/3 cup chopped dark chocolate
1/4 cup unsweetened cacao powder
1/4 cup unsweetened applesauce
1/4 cup date paste
1 tsp baking soda
1 tsp vanilla powder
2. 3. 4. 5. 6. 7. Preheat your oven to 350°F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the oat flour, cacao powder, vanilla powder, and baking soda
until well combined.
In a separate bowl, mix the date paste, applesauce, and plant milk until smooth.
Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, stirring until a thick, sticky dough forms. If
using, fold in the chopped dark chocolate.
Scoop about 3 tablespoons of dough for each cookie and roll it into a ball. Flatten slightly and place
them on the prepared baking sheet, leaving some space between each cookie.
Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the cookies have puffed up slightly and appear set
but still soft in the center.
Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to
cool completely.
Hamantaschen
By: The Jaroudi Family
Makes one dozen
Ingredients:
2 cups whole wheat pastry flour
1/4 cup unsweetened applesauce
1/4 cup date paste
1/3 cup unsweetened plant milk
1 tsp vanilla powder
1 tsp baking powder
Date-Fig Jam Filling:
1 cup dried figs, chopped
1 cup pitted dates, chopped
1/4 cup water (add more as needed for desired consistency)
1 tsp fresh lemon juice
1/2 tsp Ceylon cinnamon
Optional: Fine date sugar for sprinkling over finished cookies
2. 3. 4. 5. 6. In a small saucepan, combine the chopped figs, dates, water, lemon juice, and cinnamon. Cook over
medium heat until the fruit is soft, about 5-7 minutes. Blend the mixture into a smooth paste using an
immersion blender or a small food processor. Set aside to cool.
In a mixing bowl, combine whole wheat pastry flour, vanilla powder, and baking powder.
In a separate bowl, whisk together applesauce, date paste, and plant milk.
Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, mixing until a soft dough forms.
Wrap the dough in parchment paper and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Preheat your oven to 350°F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
8. 9. Roll out the chilled dough on a lightly floured surface to about 1/8-inch thickness.
Use a round cookie cutter or a glass to cut out 3-inch circles.
Place a small dollop of the date-fig jam filling in the center of each circle.
Pinch the edges of the dough to form a triangular shape, leaving the filling exposed in the center.
Arrange the cookies on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 15 minutes or until the edges are lightly golden.
Allow to cool completely on a wire rack before serving.
Mini Holiday Cheesecakes
By: The Jaroudi Family
Makes one dozen
Ingredients:
1 cup dates (softened if needed)
1 cup raw almonds or walnuts
1 tsp vanilla powder
2 cups cashews, softened*
1 cup silken tofu
1/4 cup unsweetened plant milk
1/4 cup date sugar
2 Tbsp lemon juice
1 tsp vanilla powder
2 cups fresh or frozen fruit
Notes: You can swap the cashews in the filling for cooked white beans.
Blend dates, nuts, and vanilla in a food processor until the mixture is sticky and holds together when
Line a 12-cup muffin tin with parchment liners or silicone molds.
Press about 2-3 tablespoons of the crust mixture into the bottom of each cup, packing it down firmly.
Place in the freezer to set.
Blend soaked cashews, silken tofu, date sugar, lemon juice, vanilla, and in a high-speed blender until
smooth and creamy.
Spoon the filling evenly into the muffin cups over the crust layer. Smooth the tops. Freeze for 1-2 hours
until firm if making this raw.
In a small saucepan over medium heat, cook until the fruit soften and release their juices. Mash lightly
or blend for a smoother topping.
Once the cheesecakes are set, spoon the fruit topping onto each one.
Raw: Serve chilled. Store leftovers in the freezer and let thaw slightly before serving.
Cooked: Cook the mini cheesecakes at 350°F for 15 minutes and let cool before removing from pan.
Cinnamon Roll Cookies
By: The Jaroudi Family
Makes one dozen
Ingredients:
Cookie Dough:
1 1/2 cups oat flour
1/2 cup almond flour
1/4 cup unsweetened applesauce
2 Tbsp date paste
2 Tbsp unsweetened plant based milk
1 tsp vanilla powder
1/2 tsp baking powder
1/2 tsp Ceylon cinnamon
Cinnamon Filling:
1/4 cup date paste
1 tsp Ceylon cinnamon
1 Tbsp unsweetened plant based milk
Date Sugar Glaze:
3 Tbsp date sugar
4 Tbsp unsweetened plant based milk
2. 3. 4. 5. 6. 7. 8. Combine oat flour, almond flour, baking powder, vanilla powder, and cinnamon in a large mixing bowl.
Add applesauce, date paste, and plant based milk. Mix until a soft dough forms.
Cover the dough and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Mix date paste, cinnamon, and plant milk in a small bowl.
Preheat the oven to 350°F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Roll the dough between two sheets of parchment paper into a rectangle about 1/4 inch thick.
Spread the cinnamon filling evenly over the dough.
Roll the dough tightly into a log and refrigerate for another 15 minutes to firm up.
Slice the log into 12 equal pieces and place them cut-side down on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 12-15 minutes or until lightly golden. Let them cool completely.
In a small bowl, whisk date sugar and plant-based milk until smooth. Adjust milk for desired thickness.
Drizzle the glaze over the cooled cookies. Allow the glaze to set before serving.
Birdseed Cookie
By: The Jaroudi Family
Makes one dozen
Ingredients:
1 cup rolled oats
1/2 cup raw sunflower seeds, chopped
1/4 cup raw pumpkin seeds, chopped
1/4 cup raw sesame seeds
1/4 cup flaxseeds meal
1/4 cup raisins or unsweetened dried fruit
1/2 cup unsweetened applesauce
3 large ripe bananas, mashed
1 tsp vanilla powder
1/2 tsp Ceylon cinnamon
1/4 tsp ground nutmeg
2. 3. 4. 5. 6. 7. Set your oven to 350°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper to prevent sticking.
In a large bowl, combine the rolled oats, sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, sesame seeds, and ground
flaxseeds. Stir in the Ceylon cinnamon, vanilla, and nutmeg until the mixture is evenly blended.
In a separate bowl, mix the unsweetened applesauce, and mashed banana until smooth.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry mixture. Stir until all components are well incorporated. If you're
adding raisins or dried fruit, fold them in at this stage.
Scoop approximately 3 tablespoons of the mixture and shape it into a ball. Place it on the prepared
baking sheet and flatten it gently with your hand or the back of a spoon to achieve a flat, cookie-like
shape. Repeat this process to make 12 cookies.
Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and bake for 15 minutes, or until the cookies are golden
brown around the edges.
Once baked, remove the cookies from the oven and allow them to cool on the baking sheet for a few
minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
Colorful Frosting
By: The Jaroudi Family
Ingredients:
Base Recipe:
1 1/2 cups cashews, softened*
1/2 cup unsweetened plant milk
1/4 cup date sugar
2-4 tsp beet powder
or 2-4 tsp pomegranate powder
2-4 tsp strawberry powder
or 2-4 raspberry powder
Blue/Purple:
2-4 tsp butterfly pea powder
2-4 tsp matcha powder
or 2-4 tsp spinach powder
2-4 tsp pineapple powder
or 2-4 tsp turmeric powder
Notes: You can use raw sunflower seeds if avoiding nuts
2. 3. 4. 5. Blend all the ingredients in a high-speed blender until smooth and creamy.
Pick your color. Add 2 tsp for a lighter color and 4 tsp for a deeper color.
Use immediately or refrigerate in an airtight container for up to 3 days.
Use in a pastry bag with an icing tip.
Perfect for cookies, cupcakes, or cakes!
notes: You can swap a whole wheat flour for a gluten-free flour. Notes**: You may replace the almond meal and whole-wheat flour for another option. This recipe works well with oat flour, buckwheat flour, or spelt flour. Directions: 1\. 2. 3. 4. 5. 6. 7. 8. Set your oven to 375°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the whole wheat flour, baking powder, baking soda, Ceylon cinnamon, and nutmeg. In a separate bowl, mix the applesauce, date paste, vanilla powder, and plant milk until smooth. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Fold in the diced apple. Drop small balls of dough (about 3 tablespoons each) onto the prepared baking sheet using a spoon or cookie scoop. Leave space between them as they will expand slightly. Bake for 15-18 minutes or until the fritters are firm to the touch and lightly golden. Let them cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack. Mix the date paste, almond butter or tahini, plant milk, and vanilla powder until smooth and pourable in a small bowl. Add more plant milk if needed. Once the fritters have cooled slightly, drizzle or brush the glaze over the top. Let the glaze set for a few minutes before serving.

name: Apple-Raspberry Crisp
description: A apple-raspberry crisp recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: medium sweet apples, such as Gala or Fuji, chopped (48 ounces)

directions: Preheat the oven to 425°F.

In a skillet over medium heat, cook chopped apples, stirring occasionally, until they begin to soften, 5 to 7 minutes. Add a bit of water if needed to keep apples from sticking. Transfer apples to an 11-inch square or 13x9-inch rectangular baking dish; top with raspberries.

In a bowl, combine oat flour, rolled oats, maple syrup, almond butter, baking powder, and salt; rub in with fingertips until mixture comes together in small clumps. Spread the crumble over the fruit. Bake until golden brown, about 20 minutes.
Serve warm.

name: Baked Salmon II
description: A classic marinade of garlic, olive oil, basil, and lemon that lets the salmon shine. Simple, healthy, and foolproof.
directions: In a medium glass bowl, mix together garlic, olive oil, basil, salt, pepper, lemon juice, and parsley to make the marinade.
Place salmon fillets in a medium glass baking dish and pour the marinade over them, making sure they are fully coated.
Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for about 1 hour, turning the fillets occasionally.
Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Place each fillet on a piece of aluminum foil, spoon some marinade over the top, and seal the foil into a packet.
Place the foil packets in a baking dish and bake for 35 to 45 minutes, until the salmon flakes easily with a fork.
Carefully open the foil packets (watch out for steam), plate the salmon, and garnish with any extra parsley.
notes: Use wild-caught Alaskan salmon when you can find it — Costco carries it frozen and it's excellent. The foil packet method keeps the fish moist and almost impossible to overcook.

name: Balsamic Salad Dressing
description: A balsamic salad dressing recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Combine all ingredients with 2 teaspoons water in a jar or Tupperware container.
Close lid, and shake for a few seconds to mix well.

name: Beans on Toast
description: A beans on toast recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: family size can vegetarian baked beans

directions: Lightly toast your bread either with a broiler, or toaster and spread out on a baking tray
Strain half of the liquid from the baked beans and warm them in a glass bowl in the microwave
Spread a nice layer of baked beans on each slice of toast and top with a bit of vegan cheese
Place the pan back in the oven, or broiler and let warm just until the cheese is melted

name: Beef Stew
description: A hearty, classic beef stew with tender chuck, root vegetables, and a rich savory broth. Simple and deeply satisfying.
directions: Cut beef chuck into 1.5-inch cubes, trimming any large fat chunks but leaving most of it. In a bowl, combine flour, sea salt, black pepper, onion powder, and Italian seasoning. Toss the beef cubes in the flour mixture until evenly coated.

Heat cooking oil in a large Dutch oven or heavy pot over medium-high heat. Brown the beef in batches — do not crowd the pan. Sear each batch for about 3-4 minutes per side until a deep brown crust forms. Transfer to a plate and set aside.
Reduce heat to medium. Add the diced onion to the same pot and cook for 4-5 minutes, scraping up the browned bits from the bottom.
Add the minced garlic and cook for 30 seconds until fragrant. Add the tomato paste and stir for 1 minute until it darkens slightly.
Add the balsamic vinegar and Worcestershire sauce, stirring to deglaze the pot and loosen any remaining browned bits.
Return the beef to the pot. Pour in the beef broth and add the bay leaf. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a low simmer. Cover and cook for 1.5 hours.
Add the Yukon potatoes, sweet potato, and carrots. Stir to combine, cover, and simmer for another 45-60 minutes until the vegetables are tender and the beef is fork-tender.
Remove the bay leaf. Taste and adjust salt and pepper as needed. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve.
notes: This stew is even better the next day — make it ahead if you can. The flour coating on the beef naturally thickens the broth as it cooks. If you want it thicker, mash a couple of the potato chunks against the side of the pot and stir them in.

name: Berry Crumb Muffins
description: A berry crumb muffins recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: plant-based milk (such as soy or almond)
mixed berries (fresh or frozen and thawed

directions: Preheat your oven to 400F (200C). Line 12 wells of a muffin pan with paper liners or lightly grease the pan.
To make the crumb topping: in a small bowl, mix together all the crumb topping ingredients with a fork until crumbly. Set aside.
To make the berry muffins: In a large bowl whisk together all the dry ingredients.

In a medium bowl mix together the plant-based milk, light oil, lemon juice, and vanilla extract. Pour wet into dry and mix until just combined. Don't over mix, lumps are totally cool. Add in the berries and lightly fold them in.
Divide the batter evenly among the prepared muffin tin. Top each with a spoonful of the crumb topping mixture, dividing it evenly among all 12 muffins.
Bake for 18 to 25 minutes until lightly golden on top and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cool in the pan.

name: Best Baked Tofu
description: A best baked tofu recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: green onion, thinly sliced, for garnish

directions: Carefully pat tofu dry: On a cutting board, sandwich tofu between doubled layers of paper towels and press down slowly to remove moisture without cracking the block. Remove paper towels and cut tofu into 32 equal pieces: halve tofu laterally across, then cut the block into a 4x4 grid.

Make marinade: In a medium bowl, whisk together garlic, ginger, soy sauce, Sriracha, 2 tablespoons sesame oil, vinegar, and sugar until smooth. Set aside half this mixture and reserve for glazing later.
Preheat oven to 400°. Meanwhile, add tofu to bowl and toss gently to coat in marinade. Let sit 15 minutes, then drain off excess marinade.
In a small bowl, whisk together cornstarch and baking powder. Sprinkle over tofu and gently toss to coat evenly. Drizzle over remaining 1 tablespoon sesame oil and toss to coat each piece.

Spread tofu evenly out onto a baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes. After 15 minutes, decrease oven temperature to 375°. Flip tofu pieces to allow for even toasting, then return tray to oven and continue to bake until tofu is crispy on the outside and deeply golden, about 15 minutes more.
Brush with reserved marinade mixture for a glaze finish, then sprinkle with green onions and sesame.

name: Best Brownies
description: A best brownies recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour an 8-inch square pan.
Melt 1/2 cup butter in a large saucepan. Remove from heat, and stir in sugar, eggs, and 1 teaspoon vanilla. Beat in 1/3 cup cocoa, flour, salt, and baking powder. Spread batter into prepared pan.
Bake in the preheated oven until top is dry and edges have started to pull away from the sides of the pan, about 25 to 30 minutes.

name: Best Chili Ever
description: A best chili ever recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Instant Pot:
Add everything to the instant pot except for refried beans ans masa harina
Cook on high pressure for 15 minutes
Stir in the refried beans and masa harina if it still needs thickening.
Stove Top:
Chop onions and peppers into a large soup pot or dutch oven
Saute in a little veggie broth until translucent and softened.
Add minced garlic and saute for an additional 30 seconds until fragrant
Add any kind of meat substitute (if using) or dry, uncooked bulgur and continue to stir for a few minutes until heated through
Add tomatoes, tomato sauce, and remaining broth
Add in spices and stir until mixed well
Add all the beans and jalapeños and stir
Sprinkle up to 1-2 Tbs of the Masa on top if you think it needs thickening.  The masa adds a slight 'corn tortilla' or 'tamale' flavor to the chili.
Give the chili one more good stir and bring it to a slow boil.
Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 15 to 30 minutes.

name: Black Bean and Rice Enchiladas
description: A black bean and rice enchiladas recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chilies
vegan shredded Cheddar cheese or cheese sauce

directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat; cook and stir green pepper, onion, and garlic until tender, about 7 minutes.
Stir in beans, tomatoes, picante sauce, chili powder, cumin, and red pepper flakes; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and simmer, uncovered, until heated through and mixture thickens, about 5 minutes.
Fold in rice and 1 cup Cheddar cheese; cook until heated through, about 5 minutes.

Spoon a rounded 1/2 cup bean mixture down the center of each tortilla. Fold sides over filling and roll up. Place enchiladas seam side down in baking dish; spoon salsa over each tortilla. Cover baking dish with aluminum foil.
Bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes. Uncover and sprinkle with cilantro and 1/4 cup Cheddar cheese. Bake until cheese is melted, 2 to 3 minutes.

name: Black Bean Burgers
description: A black bean burgers recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: (100g) finely chopped bell pepper (1/2 of a pepper)
(130g) finely chopped yellow onion (1/2 of a large onion)

directions: Preheat oven to 325°F (163°C). Spread beans evenly onto a lined baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes until slightly dried out.

Meanwhile, sauté olive oil, chopped pepper, onion, and garlic over medium heat until peppers and onions are soft, about 5-6 minutes. Gently blot some of the moisture out. Place in a large bowl or in a food processor with the remaining ingredients (cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, smoked paprika, bread crumbs, cheese, eggs, worcestershire, ketchup, salt, and pepper). Stir or pulse everything together, then add the black beans. Mash with a fork or pulse the mixture, leaving some larger chunks of beans.
Form into patties, about 1/2 cup (130g) of mixture each, about 3/4-inch thick.

To bake: Place patties on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and bake at 375°F (191°C) for 10 minutes on each side, 20 minutes total. To grill: Place patties on greased aluminum foil and grill 8 minutes on each side. Heat temperature is personal preference as all grills differ. Generally, black bean burgers should grill on medium-high heat about 350°F (177°C) – 400°F (204°C).
Serve with your favorite toppings. Store leftovers in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.
Mom’s Pizza
Ingredients:
* 2 cups warm water
* 2 tsp yeast
* 2 Tbsp sugar
* 2 Tbsp Olive oil
* 5 cups flour (half wheat and half all purpose)
* 2 tsp salt
* Cornmeal
* 1 28 oz can petite diced tomatoes, drained
* 1 15 oz can tomato sauce
* 1 6 oz can tomato paste or pumpkin puree
* 1 tsp garlic powder
* 1 tsp onion powder
* ½ tsp basil
* ½ tsp oregano
* Pinch of sugar, salt, and pepper
* 4 cups vegan mozzarella style shreds, or vegan mozzarella sauce page 175
* Toppings of your choice
In a stand mixer add the warm water, sugar, and yeast ans stir
Let rest for 10 minutes
Add olive oil, 3 cups of flour, and salt
Mix with paddle attachment for 5 minutes, or until it becomes a bit stringy.
Switch to the dough hook attachment and mix in the rest of the flour slowly until it comes together in a ball and is not too sticky to handle.
Let the dough rise in an oiled bowl for 1 hour, or until doubled.
Meanwhile, mix all of the sauce ingredients together in a bowl and set aside.
Chop any toppings you would like to go on top.
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees
Pray 2 baking sheets lightly with oil and sprinkle with cornmeal.
Divide the dough in half and roll to the edges
Top with sauce, cheese, and desired toppings
Bake 12-15 minutes until crust begins to brown and cheese is all melted.

name: Black Bean, Corn, and Quinoa Salad
description: A black bean, corn, and quinoa salad recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: small red bell pepper, seeded and chopped
salt and ground black pepper to taste

directions: Bring vegetable broth to a boil in a 2-quart saucepan. Stir in quinoa. Reduce heat to low; simmer, covered, until broth is absorbed, 15 to 20 minutes. 2. Remove from heat; stir in corn. Cover and let stand until corn is warmed through, about 5 minutes.

Whisk lime juice, red wine vinegar, lime zest, and cumin together in a large bowl. Whisk in avocado oil. Add black beans, red bell pepper, red onion, and cilantro. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in quinoa and corn.

name: Bok Choy Caesar Salad
description: A bok choy caesar salad recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: For the croutons:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
While your oven preheats, cut up the bread into small cubes.
Add olive oil, garlic powder, basil, and salt to the bread and mix well together.
Pop bread into the preheated oven and bake it for 10 minutes or until it’s nice and crispy.
For the roasted chickpeas:
Take the skin off the chickpeas by rolling them on a paper napkin (NOTE: I’m not sure if this is a necessary step, so feel free to skip it if you like)
Add a little bit of oil to a frying pan and add in the chickpeas. Roast until they’re nice, brown, and crispy on the outside. (NOTE: You can roast the chickpeas in an oven, too.)
To prepare the bok choy:
Wash the bok choy or baby bok choy.
Chop into small pieces and set aside.
For the vegan caesar dressing:

In a small bowl, mix together vegan mayo, lemon juice, dijon mustard, maple syrup or agave nectar, nutritional yeast, garlic powder, and black pepper. (Feel free to add in more of the ingredients if you like)
And now for the assembly:
Place the baby bok choy, roasted chickpeas, and croutons onto a bowl.
Add your vegan caesar dressing.

name: Bolognese with Mushrooms & Red Lentils
description: A bolognese with mushrooms & red lentils recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: medium onion, roughly chopped (1 onion yields ~2 cups or 195 g)
medium carrot, roughly chopped (1 carrot yields ~1/4 cup or 60 g)
large cloves garlic (4 large cloves yield ~2 Tbsp or 18 g)
whole baby bella or cremini mushrooms
dry pasta, ideally a short tube shape like rigatoni or penne (gluten-free as needed)

directions: Chop the onion, carrot, and garlic finely, or chop in a food processor.
Saute the finely chopped onion, carrot, and garlic and sauté until translucent and soft, stirring occasionally.
Meanwhile, finely chop the mushrooms and add to the pan and cook for 3-4 minutes.
Add the tomato paste, sea salt, crushed red pepper flakes, crushed tomatoes, water, and lentils.

Bring the sauce to a boil and cover the pan. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for ~30 minutes, stirring about every 10 minutes, until the sauce has thickened and the lentils are tender and starting to break down. Then stir in the optional chopped basil and turn off the heat.
Meanwhile, cook your pasta while it simmers.
Can serve over Spaghetti Squash as well. Or a mix of spaghetti and squash.

name: Breakfast Burritos
description: A breakfast burritos recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: small red bell pepper, chopped small
small green bell pepper, chopped small

directions: sautéing)
Crumble the tofu into small pieces using a fork or your
In a large non-stick skillet, heat the vegetable broth or
water over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté for 2-3
minutes until softened.
Stir in the red and green bell peppers, and cook for 3-4
minutes until slightly softened
Push the vegetables to one side of the pan and add the
crumbled tofu. Sprinkle turmeric, smoked paprika, cumin,
black pepper, and nutritional yeast over the tofu. Stir
everything together and cook for 5 minutes, allowing the
spices to coat the tofu and vegetables evenly.
Fold in the black beans and chopped greens. Cook for 2-3
minutes until the greens are wilted and the beans are
Divide the tofu scramble evenly among the 4 flax wraps.
Roll them up or fold them as desired.
THE J A R O U D I FA M I LY

name: Breakfast Pudding
description: A breakfast pudding recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Place in a high speed blender and blend with tamper until completely smooth.
Top with granola and other fresh fruit like grapes, bananas, and berries
Variations:
* Mango Pineapple Banana
* Ginger Mango
* Mixed Berry
* Raspberry
* Blueberry
* Strawberry
* Strawberry Banana
* Orange Mango
Ginger Mango Smoothie (Pudding)
Ingredients:
* 2 inch or 2-3 Tbsp fresh ginger, chopped
* 2 boxes silken tofu
* 2 small bananas
* 2 Tbsp honey
* 2 tsp vanilla
* ½ bag or 16 oz frozen mango
* ¼ bag or 8 oz frozen pineapple
Place the ingredients in order listed into a high speed blender
Not all of the frozen fruit will fit.
Blend on high speed, using a tamper until there is enough room at the top to add the rest of the frozen fruit.
Add the rest and continue blending on high, pushing down with tamper, until all the fruit is blended in, or until the blender turns off by itself.

name: Broccoli Cheddar Soup
description: A broccoli cheddar soup recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Chop all vegetables (except broccoli and po) and add to soup pot.
Add 4 cups of Vegetable Broth and bring to a boil.
Cook until vegetables are soft and then carefully blend soup using blender or immersion blender.
Stir in milk and all seasonings and mix well.
Adjust any seasonings as necessary and then add frozen broccoli
Simmer on low heat for 5-10 min until broccoli is heated through
Serve with your favorite bread or side dish

name: Brown Gravy
description: A brown gravy recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Toast dry ingredients over low heat until aromatic
Slowly add veggie broth, whisking to remove any clumps
Add soy sauce, mustard, and kitchen bouquet and stir to combine
Simmer on med-low heat until bubbly and thickened

name: Butter Bean Butterscotch Squares
description: A butter bean butterscotch squares recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: plant milk (only if needed for blending consistency)

directions: 2. 3. 4. 5. In a food processor, blend the cooked butter beans, date sugar, tahini, vanilla, and miso until smooth and
creamy. Scrape down the sides as needed.
Add the oat flour and pulse until fully combined. If the mixture is too thick to blend, add 1-3
tablespoons of plant milk until you get a thick, dough-like consistency.
Press the mixture evenly into an 8x8-inch pan lined with parchment paper. Use a spatula to smooth the
Refrigerate for at least 2-3 hours or until firm.
Cut into 16 squares and enjoy!

name: Buttercream Frosting
description: A buttercream frosting recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Beat together butter, shortening, and vanilla with an electric mixer in a large bowl until creamy. Blend in confectioners' sugar, 1 cup at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in milk; continue mixing until icing is light and fluffy. Store icing covered until ready to use.

name: Butternut Squash Soup
description: A butternut squash soup recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: (3-pound) butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed

directions: Heat a large pot over medium heat. Add the onion, salt, and several grinds of fresh pepper and sauté until soft, 5 to 8 minutes.
Add the squash and cook until it begins to soften, stirring occasionally, for 8 to 10 minutes.
Add the garlic, sage, rosemary, and ginger. Stir and cook 30 seconds to 1 minute, until fragrant
Add 3 cups of the broth. Bring to a boil, cover, and reduce heat to a simmer. Cook until the squash is tender, 20 to 30 minutes.

Let cool slightly and pour the soup into a blender, working in batches if necessary, and blend until smooth. If your soup is too thick, add up to 1 cup more broth and blend. Season to taste and serve.

name: Butterscotch Pudding
description: A butterscotch pudding recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: Japanese (white) sweet potatoes, steamed and cooled

directions: Cook the sweet potatoes in the instant pot by filling the pot with 1 cup of water and placing a trivet on the bottom. Place sweet potatoes on the trivet and cook on manual for 15 minutes. Let cool in the fridge overnight.
Peel sweet potatoes and add them and the rest of the ingredients into a high speed blender.
Blend until completely smooth and refrigerate until chilled.

name: Caitlyn’s Sacrament Bread
description: A caitlyn’s sacrament bread recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: In a large bowl, mix the sugar, yeast, and warm water. Let sit for 10 minutes
Add salt, oil, and gradually flour until a slightly sticky dough forms
Let rise in an oiled bowl for 1 hour, or until doubled
Punch down the dough and divide into 2 loaves.
Place into 2 well oiled loaf pans and let rise for 30 minutes, or until it rises 1 inch above the rim.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees
Bake the bread for 18-20 minutes
Turn out of bread pans and let cool on a cooling rack.

name: Carrot Dogs
description: A carrot dogs recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Cut and peel carrots to make them "bun length'.
UPDATED INSTANT POT INSTRUCTIONS:

Add cut carrots and marinade to Instant Pot. Attach and seal lid, then cook on MANUAL for 3-5 minutes.  3 minutes if grilling, 5 minutes if not grilling. After doing a Quick Release you can then leave the carrots in the pot until you are ready to grill (optional), allowing to marinate and add flavor.
I would marinate the carrots after the pressure has been released for at least 1 hour.  If not grilling soon - remove carrots and marinade and transfer to a container you can store in the fridge.

name: Cashew Cheese Ball
description: A cashew cheese ball recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: Raw Cashews (150g) Soaked in hot water for 1 hour

directions: Place the raw cashews into a bowl and pour over boiling hot water from the kettle. Leave them to soak for an hour.

Drain the cashews and add to the blender along with lemon juice, coconut oil, miso paste, salt, paprika, cayenne pepper, dijon mustard, nutritional yeast, crushed garlic and water and blend until smooth.
Transfer the mixture to a mixing bowl and stir in fresh chopped basil and 1 Tbsp of chopped chives.
Line a small bowl with plastic wrap and spoon the mixture into the bowl. Twist the plastic wrap to seal it, creating a ball shape.
Place the bowl with your cheese ball into the freezer for 1 hour to set.
While the cheese is setting, crush roasted and salted almonds and place them into a wide bowl.
Add the remaining 1 Tbsp chopped chives and mix in with the crushed almonds.
After 1 hour remove the cheese ball from the freezer and gently remove the plastic wrap.
Gently roll the cheese ball in the crushed almonds and chives, or craisins, making sure the ball is evenly coated.
Return the cheese ball to the small bowl that it set in and refrigerate for 30 minutes or until you’re ready to serve.
Serve with crackers, or veggies
Jalapeño Ranch Sauce
Ingredients
* 1 cup mayonnaise
* ½ cup raw cashews
* ½ cup water
* 6 Tablespoons pickled jalapeno juice (from a jar of pickled jalapenos)
* 6 Tablespoons pickled jalapenos (diced)
* 4 teaspoon paprika
* 4 teaspoons ground cumin
* 2 teaspoon garlic granules
* 2 teaspoon onion powder
* 1 teaspoon salt (or to taste)
* 1 teaspoon chili powder
Add all the ingredients in a high speed blender and blend until smooth. Refrigerate until needed.

name: Cheddar Biscuits
description: A cheddar biscuits recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: * Preheat oven to 450 degrees
* Whisk almond milk and vinegar together and set aside
* Mix all dry ingredients in a large bowl
* Add cheese sauce and stir in with a fork until it resembles large crumbs.
* Slowly pour in buttermilk mixture and stir with a wooden spoon until just slightly combined
* Spoon out onto a floured work surface and gently knead 2-3 times
* Roll out dough to 1" thickness and cut circles with cup, glass, jar, or biscuit cutter.
* Place biscuits on parchment lined cookie sheet so they touch each other
* Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown.

name: Cheese Sauce
description: A cheese sauce recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: If you have a high speed blender, no soaking is needed: To soften the cashews: Boil them for 10 minutes until soft. OR soak the cashews for four hours or overnight. Drain before using.
To make the nacho vegan nacho cheese: Add the cashews, water, and all the remaining ingredients to a blender, and blend until smooth. It will be very watery.

Pour into a small saucepan and heat over medium-high heat, while stirring. This will ensure a smooth cheese texture. As you stir it will start forming clumps, and then all of a sudden it will become a cheesy gooey mass of yumminess. This takes about 5 minutes, continue to cook until it is the thickness you desire.

name: Cherry Chocolate Bliss Balls
description: A cherry chocolate bliss balls recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Preheat the oven to 325°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

Combine the oats, dates, almonds, chocolate chips, cherries, vanilla, and salt in a food processor. Pulse until coarsely chopped and the mixture starts to bind. Add 1 to 2 tablespoons of water if needed, to help bind.
For each bliss ball, scoop 1 tablespoon of the mixture, gently roll it into a ball, and place on the prepared baking sheet. Be careful not to compact the balls.
Bake for 20 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack to let cool.

name: Chicken Broccoli Wreath
description: A chicken broccoli wreath recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: minced garlic or a couple garlic cloves in the garlic press
Mrs Dash table blend not in original recipe

name: Chickpea Chocolate Balls
description: A chickpea chocolate balls recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: powdered nut butter, reconstituted (mix with water as per package instructions to create a peanut

directions: 2. 3. 4. 5. 6. 7. In a food processor, blend chickpeas, date paste, oat flour, vanilla, and reconstituted powdered nut butter.
Blend until fully combined.
Scoop out small portions of the mixture (about 1-2 tablespoons each) and roll into balls.
Place on a parchment-lined baking sheet or plate.
Refrigerate or freeze the balls for about 30 minutes to firm up.
In a double boiler or microwave, melt the 100% dark chocolate until smooth. If microwaving, heat in
15-second intervals, stirring in between to prevent burning.
Coat each ball in melted chocolate, allowing excess to drip off. Place back on the parchment-lined sheet.
Refrigerate the dipped balls until the chocolate hardens.

name: Chickpea Chocolate Chip Cookie
description: A chickpea chocolate chip cookie recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: 1/4 cups canned chickpeas, well-rinsed and patted dry with a paper towel
+ 2 tablespoons (165 grams) natural peanut butter, SunButter Natural or almond butter - room temperature
(80 grams) honey (agave or maple syrup for vegan)

directions: Preheat your oven to 350°F / 175°C. Combine all the ingredients, except for the chocolate chips, in a food processor and process until very smooth. Make sure to scrape the sides and the top to get the little chunks of chickpeas and process again until they're combined.
Put in the chocolate chips and stir it if you can, or pulse it once or twice. The mixture will be very thick and sticky.

With wet hands, form into 1 1/2" balls. Place onto a Silpat or a piece of parchment paper. If you want them to look more like normal cookies, press down slightly on the balls. They don't do much rising.
Bake for about 15 minutes. The dough balls will still be very soft when you take them out of the oven. They will not set like normal cookies.
Store in an airtight container at room temperature (or in the fridge) for up to 1 week.

name: Chickpea Chowder
description: A chickpea chowder recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: apple cider vinegar or lemon juice

directions: In a large pot saute onions, celery, and carrots until a bit soft.
In a blender mix together the chickpeas, broth, aquafaba, and tomato paste.
Add the blender ingredients to the pot along with the spices, potato, and mushrooms. If you have extra chickpeas left over, add them too.
Let simmer for 15-20 minutes until the potatoes are soft.
Stir in the kale and vinegar and enjoy.

name: Chickpea Salad Sandwiches
description: A chickpea salad sandwiches recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Place the chickpeas in a mixing bowl and mash with a fork, leaving only a few beans whole.
Add tahini, mustard, maple syrup, red onion, celery, pickle, capers, salt and pepper, and sunflower seeds (if using) to mixing bowl. Mix to incorporate. Taste and adjust seasonings as needed.
Toast bread if desired, and prepare any other desired sandwich toppings (such as lettuce, tomato, and onion).
Scoop a healthy amount of the chickpea mixture (about ½ cup) onto one slice of bread, add desired toppings and top with second slice of bread. Repeat for additional sandwiches.

name: Chocolate Brownie Cookies
description: A chocolate brownie cookies recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: mini chocolate chips or sugar free chocolate chips

directions: * Combine dry ingredients in a large mixing bowl. It’s important to stir well so you don’t end up with a clump of baking soda in the finished cookies.
* Stir remaining ingredients in to form a batter (see video for a visual of the steps).
* If using all purpose flour, you might need to add 2-3 tsp more oil or milk of choice.
* Roll into balls.
* You can refrigerate overnight or even freeze for a later date if desired.
* When ready to bake, preheat oven to 325 F and grease a cookie sheet. Bake 9 minutes – they should look underdone when you take them out.
* Let sit 10 minutes and they will firm up. I pressed each cookie down after baking.

* I used a mini cookie scoop and got 19 the size of the ones in the pictures. I’ve not tried the recipe without the mini chips or using any flour not listed above, so make substitutions at your own risk.

name: Chocolate Cake with Chocolate Frosting
description: A chocolate cake with chocolate frosting recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: peeled  cooked, and cooled orange sweet potato (see note)
mini or regular non dairy chocolate chips
loosely packed peeled cooked, and cooled sweet potato (see note)
– 3/4 cup coconut sugar or other unrefined sugar see note
scant raw cashew butter or almond butter

directions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Lightly coat an 8” x 8” brownie/cake pan or a 9” round cake pan with coconut or other oil, and fit the bottom of the pan with a small piece of parchment paper.
In a blender (or using a handheld blender and a deep cup or vessel), puree the sweet potato, 1/2 cup of the water, maple syrup, balsamic vinegar, and vanilla extract until completely smooth.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, coconut sugar, chocolate chips, and sea salt, then sift in the cocoa, baking powder, and baking soda.

Add the wet ingredients to the dry (be sure to scrape out all the blended ingredients with a spatula, and use the remaining 1 tablespoon of water to rinse the blender jar and get out any remaining puree).
Mix until just well incorporated.
Transfer to the prepared pan, bake for 21–23 minutes, remove, and let cool on a cooling rack.
Frosting:
Place the sweet potato, coconut sugar, cocoa powder, cashew butter, sea salt, 1–2 tablespoons of the milk, and vanilla extract in a blender or food processor and puree until very smooth.
It’s best to use a blender or processor (versus a stand mixer) if using orange sweet potato, to fully smooth out the potato.

Taste, and add more sweetener if desired, and also another 2–3 tablespoons of milk if needed to thin to preferred consistency (you may need more milk using yellow sweet potato as they aren’t quite as moist as the orange).
Puree until smooth, scraping down the blender/processor bowl as needed.
Transfer to a container and refrigerate until ready to use on the Sweet Potato Chocolate Cake. Or, get a spoon and dig in!

name: Chocolate Chia Pudding
description: A chocolate chia pudding recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: cacao powder or unsweetened cocoa powder
Almond Breeze Almondmilk Original Unsweetened (or light coconut milk for creamier texture!)

directions: To a small mixing bowl add cacao powder (sift first to reduce clumps), maple syrup, ground cinnamon, salt, and vanilla and whisk to combine. Then add a little dairy-free milk at a time and whisk until a paste forms. Then add remaining dairy-free milk and whisk until smooth.

Add chia seeds and whisk once more to combine. Then cover and refrigerate overnight, or at least 3-5 hours (until it's achieved a pudding-like consistency). It may also be helpful to give the mixture an extra whisk/stir once it has been in the refrigerator for 30-45 minutes.
Leftovers keep covered in the fridge for 4-5 days, though best when fresh. Serve chilled with desired toppings, such as fruit, granola, or coconut whipped cream.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies (The Best)
description: A chocolate chip cookies (the best) recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: and 1/4 cups light brown sugar, packed
and 1/3 cups all-purpose flour (be sure not to pack your flour)
chocolate chips (use vegan chocolate chips if vegan)

directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees (F). Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper; set aside.
In a large bowl mix together the coconut oil, brown sugar, and vanilla with a hand mixer, or stand mixer, beating until well combined.
Add in the coconut milk and applesauce and mix until well combined; set aside. In a separate bowl combine the flour, baking soda, and salt; whisk well to combine.
Add the dry ingredients into the wet mixture and, using a wooden spoon or very sturdy spatula, stir until ingredients are combined. The batter will be very thick! Fold in the chocolate chips.
Scoop three tablespoon sized mounds of dough onto the prepared cookie sheet, leaving a few inches between each cookie for spreading.
Bake for 8 to 10 minutes, or until the edges are golden and the centers have set.
Sprinkle with sea salt, if using. Cool cookies on the baking sheet for 15 minutes before transferring them to a cooling rack.

name: Chocolate Muffins
description: A chocolate muffins recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: 2. 1. 2. 3. 4. Preheat your oven to 375°F.
In a large bowl, combine the almond meal, whole wheat
flour, baking powder, baking soda, cocoa, date sugar, and vanilla powder.
Add the plant milk, miso, and apple cider vinegar to the dry mixture. Stir until just combined. Gently
fold in the dark chocolate chips.
Divide the batter evenly among the 12 muffin cups. I recommend a silicone muffin pan.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean. Allow
the muffins to cool in the silicone baking dish for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack
to cool completely.

name: Chocolate Zucchini Bread
description: A chocolate zucchini bread recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: melted coconut oil (or sub another neutral oil)
gluten-free oat flour (finely ground rolled oats)

directions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 C) and line a standard 9×5-inch loaf pan with parchment paper.

In a large mixing bowl, prepare flax eggs by mixing flaxseed meal and water and let rest for 5 minutes. Then add applesauce, maple syrup, coconut sugar, baking soda, baking powder, sea salt, and cocoa powder, and whisk again.
Next add the melted coconut oil and almond milk and whisk to combine. Add grated zucchini (that's been squeezed of excess moisture) and stir to combine.
Add gluten-free flour, oat flour, and almond flour and whisk until just combined. If the batter appears too thick, add a touch more almond milk. But it should be thick and scoopable.
Lastly, stir in chocolate chips. Then transfer batter to the loaf pan and top with a few more chocolate chips (optional).
Bake 45 minutes - 1 hour or until a toothpick comes out clean and the edges feel semi-firm to the touch.
Let cool for 5 minutes in the pan. Then carefully lift onto a cooling rack using the parchment paper. Texture is best when cooled completely.
Chocolate Pudding
Ingredients:
* 2 cups sweet potatoes, cooked  (308 g)
* 1 1/4 cups plant milk, unsweetened (296  mL)
* 1/2 cup cocoa or cacao powder, unsweetened (50 g)
* 4-6 pitted dates (96 g)
Blend all ingredients together in a high-speed blender until smooth.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour.

name: Coconut Cream Pie
description: A coconut cream pie recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spread coconut on a baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven, stirring occasionally, until golden brown, about 5 minutes.
Combine half-and-half, sugar, flour, eggs, and salt in a medium pot. Bring to a boil over low heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens and coats the back of a wooden spoon, about 15 minutes.
Remove the pan from the heat and stir in 3/4 cup toasted coconut and vanilla; reserve remaining toasted coconut for garnishing the pie.
Pour custard into pie shell and chill until firm, about 4 hours.
Top with whipped topping and reserved toasted coconut.

name: Conference Cinnamon Rolls Recipe by Tasty
description: A conference cinnamon rolls recipe by tasty recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Oil spray a baking dish.
In a mixing bowl, whisk together the almond milk, yeast, and sugar. Let sit for 7 minutes until bubbly.
Add 3 cups flour and 1 teaspoon of salt to the milk mixture and mix for a few minutes.
Add the remaining flour until the dough comes away from the sides of the bowl and is just slightly sticky.
Cover the bowl with a towel or plastic wrap and set in a warm place to rise for 1 hour or until doubled.
Turn out onto a well-floured surface.
Roll the dough out into a large rectangle, about ½-inch (1 cm) thick. Fix corners to make sure they are sharp and even.
Spread the softened vegan butter evenly over the dough.
Sprinkle evenly with sugar and cinnamon.
Roll up the dough, forming a log, and pinch the seam closed. Place seam-side down.
Cut the log in half, then divide each half into 7 evenly sized pieces. About 1½ inches (8 cm) thick each.
Place 7 cinnamon rolls in each cake pan, one in the center, six around the sides. Cover with plastic wrap and place in a warm place to rise for 30 minutes.
To prepare the frosting. In a medium-size mixing bowl, whisk together powdered sugar, almond milk, and vanilla until smooth.
Remove plastic wrap. Bake the cinnamon rolls in a preheated oven at 350˚F (180˚C) for 25-30 minutes, until golden brown.
While still warm, drizzle evenly with frosting.

name: Cookie Dough Hummus
description: A cookie dough hummus recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: cashews (level if pieces, slightly heaped if whole)

directions: Combine all the ingredients except the chocolate chips in a blender or food processor. See notes for the maple syrup and salt.
Blend or puree the ingredients until everything is smooth and combined well, about 2 minutes.
Fold in the chocolate chips and serve in a bowl; alternatively, store the hummus plain and add chocolate chips just before serving.

name: Cornbread
description: A cornbread recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: * Whisk the milk and vinegar together and set aside
* Sift the dry ingredients together into a large bowl and mix thoroughly
* With a large spoon or rubber spatula, slowly stir in the applesauce and maple syrup.
* Add the vegan buttermilk mixture we just made and stir just long enough to make a smooth batter
* Pour batter into a parchment-lined pan, seasoned iron skillet, or muffin tins.
* Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until an inserted toothpick comes out clean

name: Cranberry Orange Bread
description: A cranberry orange bread recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: Whole wheat flour or any flour of choice; gluten-free flour can be used as well
Unsweetened apple sauce or 1 flax egg
Maple syrup or ¾ coconut sugar

directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl.
Stir the dry ingredients, and combine the baking powder, soda, and salt with the flour.

Now add the apple sauce, orange juice, maple syrup, zest, vanilla, and cinnamon, and stir by hand, focusing on incorporating the flour mixture at the bowl's bottom. DO NOT OVER-STIR. Ensure all the dry and wet ingredients create a thick and lumpy batter.
Now, fold in the cranberries, making sure to fold gently to keep the berries intact.
Using a silicone bread pan or a pan lined with parchment paper, pour the bread batter into the pan, scraping down the bowl's sides to get all the batter.
Then, place some individual cranberries on top of the bread, randomly placing them. This adds more cranberry flavor and makes the bread pretty,
Cook for 50-55 minutes. If using a silicone bread pan, check the bread 45 minutes in, as silicone pans generally take less cooking time.
To check to ensure the bread is cooked, place a knife through the middle. It should come out clean. If there is batter on the blade, cook for 5 minutes.

name: Creamy Mushroom Potato Casserole
description: A creamy mushroom potato casserole recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: Oat/Soy Cream or Coconut Milk will work

directions: Sprigs Fresh Thyme
Pre heat your oven to 200 degrees C.

Place a large oven proof pan or casserole dish over a medium heat & add a little oil. When the pan is hot sauté the mushrooms for 8-10 minutes, stirring often making sure they’re caramelised & golden. Season with salt & pepper whilst they are cooking.

Stir through the leek, garlic, chilli, tarragon, nutmeg & the bay leaf. Cook for a few more minutes then deglaze with the brandy, if using. Cook for a couple of minutes to cook off the alcohol. Then stir through the plain flour. Cook the flour out for 1 minute then add the vegetable stock. Stir well with a spatular & bring to a simmer.

Stir through the oat cream & lemon juice. Let the mushroom filling bubble away for 10 minutes & meanwhile slice your potatoes fine using a mandolin or sharp knife. Lay the potato slices on top of the mushroom filling neatly, then drizzle over olive oil & a pinch of seasoning.
Place the pie into the oven to bake for 25 minutes or until the potatoes on top are golden and crisp.
Garnish with thyme and serve.
Beaker's Vegetable Barley Soup
Ingredients
* 2 quarts vegetable broth
* 1 (15 ounce) can garbanzo beans, drained
* 1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes with juice
* 1 cup uncooked barley
* 2 large carrots, chopped
* 2 stalks celery, chopped
* 1 onion, chopped
* 1 zucchini, chopped
* 3 bay leaves
* 1 teaspoon garlic powder
* 1 teaspoon white sugar
* 1 teaspoon salt
* 1 teaspoon dried parsley
* 1 teaspoon paprika
* 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
* ½ teaspoon ground black pepper
In a large pot add beans, tomatoes with juice, barley, carrots, celery, onion, zucchini, and bay leaves.
Season with garlic powder, sugar, salt, parsley, paprika, Worcestershire sauce, and pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat.
Cover and simmer for 1 1/2 hours. Remove bay leaves before serving.
*Or cook in the instant pot for 20 minutes.

name: Creamy Non-Dairy Mashed Potatoes
description: Rich, fluffy mashed potatoes made entirely dairy-free. Roasted garlic, soy milk, and vegan butter make these just as creamy and satisfying as the classic version.
directions: Wash and cut the yukon gold potatoes into evenly sized chunks so they cook at the same rate.

Place the potatoes and whole garlic cloves in a large pot. Cover with cold salted water. Bring to a boil then reduce to a simmer and cook for 15-20 minutes until the potatoes are completely tender when pierced with a fork.
Drain the potatoes and garlic and let them sit in the colander for 2-3 minutes to steam off excess moisture. This step keeps your mash fluffy instead of watery.
Return the potatoes and garlic to the pot. Mash with a potato masher or ricer until smooth. The garlic will mash right in and mellow beautifully.
Slowly mix in the warmed soy milk and olive oil or vegan butter, starting with half and adding more to reach your desired consistency. Warming the milk first keeps the potatoes from going gluey.
Stir in the nutritional yeast and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Taste and adjust seasoning. Garnish with chives and serve immediately.
notes: Warming the soy milk before adding is important — cold liquid makes mashed potatoes gluey. The nutritional yeast adds a subtle savory depth that makes these taste richer. Don't overwork the potatoes once the liquid goes in or they'll turn sticky.

name: Creamy Savory Rice
description: A comforting, creamy rice dish with silken tofu blended into a rich sauce, folded with cubed tofu and savory seasonings. Simple, filling, and surprisingly satisfying.
directions: In a pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add diced onion and sauté for 4-5 minutes until softened.
Add minced garlic and stir for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add arborio rice and stir for 1 minute to coat in the oil.
Pour in all 6.5 cups of broth, add salt and pepper, and bring to a boil.
Cover and reduce to a low simmer for 15 minutes. Do not stir during cooking.
While rice cooks, blend silken tofu with water or broth, nutritional yeast, and tahini until completely smooth.
Once rice is tender, turn off heat and stir in the cream blend, soy sauce, and paprika.
Fold in the extra-firm tofu cubes gently. Cover and rest for 5 minutes before serving.
notes: The silken tofu blends completely into the sauce — you won't taste it, it just adds creaminess and protein. Don't press the extra-firm tofu for this dish, the softer texture works well folded into the rice.

name: Creamy Wild Rice Soup
description: A creamy wild rice soup recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: raw cashews (soaked in 1 cup water for 3-4 hours)
apple cider vinegar or lemon juice

directions: Place a large sauce pan on medium heat and add a few tablespoons of water to it. Add in your chopped onions, garlic and mushrooms and saute until the mushrooms become translucent (about 5 minutes). If you are doing this in the instant pot you can use the saute function.

While the saute is cooking. Add your cashews (with the water from it soaking), miso, nutritional yeast and apple cider vinegar into your blender and blend on high until smooth. I use a vitamix and blend for a minute until it turns to a cream like texture.

Once the saute is done add the rest of your ingredients into your pot (except the cashew cream we just made). Bring to a boil, reduce heat to a simmer, cover and cook about 30 minutes or until the rice is soft. If you are doing this in an instant pot, cook for 22 minutes on high pressure and let it naturally release.
Once its done stir and add in your cashew cream. Add some extra black pepper on top and enjoy.

name: Crispy Baked Jackfruit Taquitos
description: A crispy baked jackfruit taquitos recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: (20-ounce) cans jackfruit in water or brine NOT in syrup
coconut sugar (or maple syrup or organic brown sugar)
small chipotle peppers in adobo sauce (from a can

directions: Pour Jackfruit in a strainer and shred and break apart with your hands
Thoroughly rinse the shreds
Squeeze as much water out as you can against the strainer
Sauté onion and garlic for 4-5 minutes or until onions are golden brown and softened.
Add jackfruit and the rest of the ingredients. Use just enough water to allow the spices to mix in. Cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Turn up heat to medium-high and cook for 3-5 minutes more to get a little extra color/texture. Then remove from heat.
Preheat the oven to 425 F
Next, warm your tortillas by wrapping them in a damp kitchen towel or paper towel and microwaving for ~30-60 seconds.
Fill the tortillas with jackfruit mix and a bit of cheddar shreds and roll up, placing seam side down onto an oiled cooking sheet.
Spray tops lightly with oil spray.
Bake for 15-20 minutes until crisp.
Serve with refried beans, vegan cheese sauce, salsa, and shredded lettuce.
Easy Fried Rice
Ingredients
* 1 small white onion, diced
* 1 cup celery leaves, chopped
* 1 cup frozen peas
* Optional ½ block firm tofu, crumbled
* ½ tsp garlic powder
* ¼ tsp ground ginger
* 6 cups cooked rice
* 3–4 tablespoons soy sauce, or more to taste
* ½ tsp fish sauce
* 1-2 teaspoons toasted sesame oil
* Optional: 3 eggs scrambled
Cook 3 cups of brown rice in the instant pot
Saute onion for about 5 minutes or until the onion is soft (adding a bit of water as you go to prevent sticking)
Add the celery leaves, peas, (optional crumbled tofu) and all the other seasonings and spices and cook until the peas are heated
Place your cooked rice in a large bowl and pour the pea mixture over it. Stir gently to season all the rice.
Taste and add more soy sauce, or whatever flavor adjustments needed.
Optional: Scramble 3 eggs and stir in to incorporate.

name: Crispy Baked Tofu
description: A crispy baked tofu recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Press the tofu: Wrap the block of tofu in paper towels. Place a plate or pan on top of the wrapped tofu, and put a couple of heavy books on top of that. Let the tofu press for 30 minutes, or up to an hour.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Slice the tofu into about 4 slices (see photos in post above for reference). Now, rip each slice into medium-large pieces.

Add the ripped tofu pieces to a large bowl, along with the olive oil, garlic powder, smoked paprika, salt and pepper. Toss, gently with a rubber spatula or spoon, until the tofu is coated in the oil and spices. You have to be careful with tofu, because it's fragile and you don't want to turn it to crumbles.
Now sprinkle on the cornstarch and toss again to coat.
Arrange on the prepared baking sheet in a single layer, not touching, and bake for 20 minutes. Flip the pieces and bake for another 10-15 minutes, until golden and crispy.
Remove from the oven and serve anywhere you like. Enjoy!
* If needed, you can use arrowroot instead of cornstarch, or leave it out entirely.
* Feel free to switch up the seasonings depending on what you plan on serving it in. For example, you can use taco seasoning, chili powder, nutritional yeast or Italian seasoning.
* Leave the oil out if needed. I’d recommend substituting the oil for low sodium soy sauce or tamari and leave out the salt.
notes: If needed, you can use arrowroot instead of cornstarch, or leave it out entirely. Feel free to switch up the seasonings depending on what you plan on serving it in. For example, you can use taco seasoning, chili powder, nutritional yeast or Italian seasoning. Leave the oil out if needed. I'd recommend substituting the oil for low sodium soy sauce or tamari and leave out the salt. Best Baked Tofu delish.com Servings: 2 - 3 serving(s) Ingredients 1 (14-oz.) block extra-firm tofu, drained 2 cloves garlic, grated 1" piece ginger, grated 2 tbsp. low-sodium soy sauce 1 tbsp. Sriracha 3 tbsp. toasted sesame oil, divided 2 tsp. rice wine vinegar 2 tbsp. packed brown sugar 1 1/2 tbsp. cornstarch 1/4 tsp. baking powder 1 green onion, thinly sliced, for garnish Toasted sesame seeds, for garnish Steps 1.  Carefully pat tofu dry: On a cutting board, sandwich tofu between doubled layers of paper towels and press down slowly to remove moisture without cracking the block. Remove paper towels and cut tofu into 32 equal pieces: halve tofu laterally across, then cut the block into a 4x4 grid. 2.  Make marinade: In a medium bowl, whisk together garlic, ginger, soy sauce, Sriracha, 2 tablespoons sesame oil, vinegar, and sugar until smooth. Set aside half this mixture and reserve for glazing later. 3.  Preheat oven to 400°. Meanwhile, add tofu to bowl and toss gently to coat in marinade. Let sit 15 minutes, then drain off excess marinade. 4.  In a small bowl, whisk together cornstarch and baking powder. Sprinkle over tofu and gently toss to coat evenly. Drizzle over remaining 1 tablespoon sesame oil and toss to coat each piece. 5.  Spread tofu evenly out onto a baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes. After 15 minutes, decrease oven temperature to 375°. Flip tofu pieces to allow for even toasting, then return tray to oven and continue to bake until tofu is crispy on the outside and deeply golden, about 15 minutes more. 6.  Brush with reserved marinade mixture for a glaze finish, then sprinkle with green onions and sesame.

name: Cutout Cookies
description: A cutout cookies recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Cream the vegan butter with the sugar until light and fluffy, about 3- 5 minutes.
Add the lemon zest, the aquafaba and the extracts to the creaming butter/sugar mixture and then stop the mixer and scrape the sides of the bowl
Next sift together the flour baking powder and salt and add it all at once to the creamed mixture. Mix just until it is all combined.

Wrap this dough disc in plastic wrap and chill for at least 2 hours or overnight before using or you can store it for up to 1 week wrapped in plastic wrap in the refrigerator, or in the freezer for 2 months.
You must re-work this dough with some additional flour to a pliable consistency after it has been chilled. Do not skip this step.
Knead it with some flour until it is no longer a crumbly mass, but a soft pliable dough
Roll out the dough to ¼" thick and cut shapes as desired
If you are dipping in crystal sugar, spritz each cookie with water and then sprinkle with the sugar.
Transfer cookie cutouts to a parchment lined sheet pan and bake in preheated to 350° F oven for approximately 18-22 minutes or until light golden brown.

name: Dairy-Free Carrot Risotto with Peas
description: A dairy-free carrot risotto with peas recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: medium carrots peeled and finely grated
fresh or frozen green peas thawed, if frozen

directions: In a small saucepan, warm vegetable stock over low heat.
Heat olive oil in a Dutch oven or larg heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat.
Add the onion and cook until translucent. Add the garlic and cook for one minute. Add the carrots and cook for about 1 minute more.
Add the rice and stir to coat. Allow rice to cook (toast) for 2-3 minutes, stirring frequently. Add the wine and cook until evaporated, stirring often.

Add one cup of the vegetable stock and cook until absorbed. Continue adding one cup at a time, stirring every 30-seconds or so, allowing stock to be absorbed each time until rice is tender and mixture is creamy. (This will take 6-7 cups of stock, you may not use it all). Stir in the salt and peas towards the end of cooking so that they may warm.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

name: Dark Chocolate Cake
description: A dark chocolate cake recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees
Grease and flour 2-9 inch cake pans
In a mixing bowl, sift together the flour cocoa, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add eggs, milk, oil, vanilla and beat for 2 minutes.
Heat water in the microwave until boiling
Stir water slowly into cake batter.
Pour batter evenly into cake pans and bake for 30-35 minutes.
Cool 10 minutes before removing from the pan and let cool on a wire cooling rack.
Decadent Chocolate Buttercream
Ingredients
6 Tbsp Butter (softened)
2 ⅔ cups powdered sugar
½ cup cocoa powder
⅓ cup milk
1 tsp vanilla
In a mixer, beat butter until smooth.
Sift powdered sugar and cocoa into a small bowl.
Add the sugar mixture and the milk alternately with the butter.
Add in vanilla and mix until light and fluffy.
Add more milk if needed to get a smooth spreadable consistency.

name: Date Delights
description: A date delights recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: raw creamy almond butter (or any nut or seed butter)

directions: Pit the dates. Place them on a small parchment-lined baking sheet and set aside.
Prepare the filling. Combine the almond butter, coconut oil and salt in a small mixing bowl.
Stuff the dates with filling. Insert 1 teaspoon of the nut butter mixture into each date. Place the baking sheet in the freezer to set.
Melt the chocolate. Melt the chocolate chips either on the stovetop or in a double boiler, or microwave in 30 second intervals for 90-120 seconds.

Coat the stuffed dates in chocolate. Use a fork to submerge each date individually into the melted chocolate so that it is fully coated on all sides. Allow excess chocolate to drip off and then transfer back to the baking sheet, making sure the dates are not touching.

Let the chocolate set. Place the baking sheet full of chocolate covered dates in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes to allow the chocolate to harden. It will naturally harden at room temperature as well but that would take at least an hour.
Enjoy! Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to one week.

name: Del’s Potato Salad
description: A del’s potato salad recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: medium red potatoes, scrubbed and chopped
(12-ounce) package firm or extra-firm silken tofu

directions: Place the potatoes in a large pot and add cold water to cover. Bring the water to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer the potatoes until just tender, 8-10 minutes. Drain the potatoes in a colander and rinse them under cold water until cool.
In a blender, combine the silken tofu, yellow mustard, Dijon mustard, garlic, lemon juice, and salt. Blend until smooth and creamy.
Transfer the mixture to a large bowl, add the relish, and stir well to combine. Add the celery, onion, and potatoes and toss gently to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Cover and chill for 1 hour. Taste and adjust seasoning before serving.
Store the salad in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.

name: Dreena’s Banana Bread
description: A dreena’s banana bread recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: whole-wheat pastry flour or 1 cup 3-4 tbsp spelt flour for wheat-free version
non-dairy mini or regular chocolate chips optional

directions: Preheat oven to 350. In a large bowl, mix dry ingredients. In a separate bowl, combine pureed banana, maple syrup, milk and vanilla. Add wet mixture to dry, and add in chocolate chips (if using), and stir through until just well combined (don’t overmix). Wipe a loaf pan lightly with oil (or use a silicone loaf pan). Pour batter into pan and bake for 43-48 minutes, until golden and a toothpick or skewer inserted in the centre comes out clean. Makes 1 quick bread.

* Gluten-Free Option: Replace all the flour with 2 full cups of certified gluten-free oat flour, or with 1 3/4 cups gluten-free flour blend (ex: Bob’s Red Mill) plus 1/2 cup and 2 tablespoons almond meal and 3/4 teaspoon xanthan gum.
* Banana Note: Puree several medium-large overripe bananas in a blender or with an immersion blender and deep cup, then measure to get your 1 cup.

* Kitchen Tip: To make muffins instead of a quick bread, pour mixture into a 12–cup muffin pan fitted with cupcake liners. Bake for 17–20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Remove, let cool for a few minutes in pan, and then transfer to a cooling rack to cool completely.
Chia Toast
Ingredients:
* Whole grain bread
* Peanut butter
* Bananas
* Chia seeds
Toast bread
Spread each with peanut butter
Topo with sliced bananas
Sprinkle with chia seeds on top

name: Dreena’s Pumpkin Muffins
description: A dreena’s pumpkin muffins recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: – 1/3 cup mini non-dairy chocolate chips optional… maybe!
flax meal or 1/2 tbsp ground white chia seed
pumpkin pie mix (see note) I use Farmer’s Market Organic brand

directions: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
In a large bowl, combine the dry ingredients, sifting in the baking powder and baking soda. Stir until well mixed.
In another bowl, first combine the maple syrup with the flax meal, and then add the remaining wet ingredients and stir until well mixed.
Add the wet mixture to the dry mixture, and gently fold and mix until just combined (do not overmix).
Let sit for a minute while preparing a muffin pan with oil spray.

Spoon the mixture into a twelve-cup lined muffin pan (filling 12). Bake for 21-22 minutes, until set to the touch. Remove from the oven, let cool for a couple of minutes in the pan, and then transfer the muffins to cool on a cooling rack.

name: Dreena’s Zucchini Bread dreenaburton.com
description: A dreena’s zucchini bread dreenaburton.com recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: whole-wheat pastry flour less 3-4 tbsp (see note)

directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare a loaf pan by spraying/wiping with a touch of oil, and lining with a strip of parchment paper (for easy removal after cooling).
In a large bowl, add dry 12`2`ingredients: flour, cocoa powder, coconut sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Stir through until well combined.

Add zucchini, bananas, maple syrup and hemp seeds (if using) to a blender. Puree until smooth (this takes just a minute in a high speed blender, a regular blender will take longer). Once well pureed, add water and vanilla and blend again.
Add wet mixture to dry and stir through until just well combined, and add chocolate chips if using. Transfer mixture to loaf pan.
Bake for 50 minutes, or until set in the center (test with a toothpick if unsure). Remove and let cool in the pan on a cooling rack. Once cool, remove loaf and cut into slices.
* Flour Note: Measure the 2 cups of flour, and then remove about 3-4 tbsp from the amount.
* Muffin Swap: If you want to make into muffins, fill 12 muffin cups (lined with parchment liners) and bake for 25 minutes.

name: Easy Microwave Caramel Popcorn
description: A easy microwave caramel popcorn recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: salt if you use microwave popcorn, then omit this salt

directions: Pop your popcorn kernels (or pop 2 microwave bags of popcorn) and place in a large bowl.

In a microwave proof bowl, I prefer Pyrex bowls, place your brown sugar, Karo syrup, butter and salt. Make sure your bowl have room for the mixture to triple in size because it will melt and then bubble up.
Microwave for 45 seconds, then remove and stir. This just gets the butter melted and everything combined.
Microwave for 1 minute and 30 seconds, remove and stir.
Microwave for an additional 1 minute and 30 seconds and stir again.
Add vanilla extract and baking soda and stir until it stops fizzing and bubbling.
Pour over popcorn and gently fold until well coated. Let cool in bowl or on parchments paper. Enjoy!

NOTE: Every microwave is a little different. After your popcorn cools, determine if you want the caramel a little softer (less microwave time) or a little harder (more microwave time). This way, the next time you make it, your can perfect this recipe for your specific microwave!

name: Easy Peanut Noodles
description: A easy peanut noodles recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: rice noodles (1/2 package Thai kitchen brand rice noodles)
to 1 tsp sriracha or other hot sauce

directions: In a small saucepan, combine all the sauce ingredients.
Heat over low heat until bubbly.
Bring about 1/2 a pasta pot of water to a boil.
Add the noodles and cook per package instructions
Microwave frozen veggies per package instructions (or add frozen veggies to the boiling pasta water if you do not want to microwave)
Drain completely, stir in sauce, and serve.

name: Easy Stir Fry
description: A easy stir fry recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
