directions: Add all the sauce ingredients to a mason jar, attach lid, and shake thoroughly
If using tofu in your stir fry,  press first to remove as much moisture as possible, then cut into cubes
Use a 1 qt mason jar to marinate tofu cubes with the sauce - at least 1 hour
Drain tofu and reserve sauce.
Bake or air fry the tofu - 375°F - about 20 minutes total - flipping midway
Clean mushrooms and cut in half
Add mushrooms to wok with a splash of veg broth or water - turn heat to high
Once broth begins to boil, add frozen veggies and stir-fry just a few minutes - until crisp-tender
Add baked tofu cubes and remaining sauce
Stir until sauce has thickened
Serve over your favorite rice or noodles

name: Easy Vegan Cabbage Roll Soup
description: A easy vegan cabbage roll soup recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: 12.3oz/ 350g block extra-firm tofu drained and crumbled
green cabbage chopped into bite-sized pieces (5 cups)
vegan beefless broth, mushroom broth, or vegetable broth plus more if needed
fresh parsley roughly chopped, for garnish

directions: To make the tofu crumbles:
Preheat your oven to 350°F
Crumble tofu into a medium bowl and mix in the rest of the crumble ingredients.
Spread the tofu crumbles evenly over the pan. Bake for 35 to 45 minutes.
To make the vegan cabbage roll soup:
In the meantime, in a large soup pot saute the carrots, onion, and garlic for about 5 minutes until the onions have turned translucent and begin to brown.
Stir in the cabbage, and all the other ingredients.
Bring the soup to a simmer and cook, stirring as needed, for about 25 minutes or until the rice and cabbage are tender.

Lastly, stir in prepared tofu crumbles and cook for 1 more minute to heat through. If your soup is too thick, stir in more broth or water to reach desired consistency. Serve hot with fresh parsley for garnish.
Green Chili Enchiladas
8 Servings
Ingredients
* 4 cups shredded cooked soy curls
* 1 onion chopped
* 4 garlic cloves, minced
* 1 family sized can cream of soup
* 2 cans chopped green chilies
* 1-2 cups soy milk
* 1 cup cashew cream
* 1 tsp paprika
* 1 tsp chili powder
* ½ tsp onion powder
* 1/2 cup fresh cilantro, finely chopped, plus more for serving
* 24 corn tortillas, or 12 large flour
* 2 cup vegan cheddar shreds
Follow package instructions for reconstituting the dry soy curls with hot water and chicken flavoring and soy sauce. Let soak while you prepare the sauce.
In a large saucepan, saute garlic and onion until fragrant but not brown.
Stir in the cream of soup and add soy milk until desired consistency.
Heat just until heated through, then turn off heat.
Stir in cashew cream, cilantro, chili powder, onion powder, and paprika. Taste and adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper.
Drain and press the soy curls and in a bowl stir in 1 cup of the sauce to the soy curls.
Cover your baking dish with a thin layer of sauce.
Warm your tortillas and fill with the soy curlz and a bit of cheddar. Roll and place in your baking dish.
Cover the rolled tortillas with the sauce and a sprinkle of more cheddar.
Cover with foil and Bake at 375°F for 15 minutes.
Then, remove the foil and bake until the cheese is melted and bubbly, about 10 minutes.
Allow the enchiladas to cool for 5 to 10 minutes so they set up a bit in the middle. Garnish with cilantro and serve.

name: Eden’s Vegan Gingerbread Cookies
description: A eden’s vegan gingerbread cookies recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: In a bowl, sift together the dry ingredients and set aside.
In a mixing bowl beat together the wet ingredients.
Add all of the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix until well combined.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees
Roll out dough and cut out desired shapes
Bake on a silicone baking mat on a cookie sheet for 10-15 minutes
Let cool before enjoying.

name: Egg Roll Bowl
description: A egg roll bowl recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: * Won ton wrappers
* Sesame seeds
First, cook some brown rice
Second, cube and season your tofu and place in the oven on a silicone mat and cook at 425 degrees for 15-20 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook onion in a large wok, or pot until soft
Add the cabbage, carrots, ginger, and oil and cook until barely wilted
Add the garlic powder, soy sauce, and maple syrup and cook just 1 more minute.
Fry the wontons one by one in a small frying pan
To assemble:
In each bowl place rice, then cabbage mixture, tofu, sesame seeds, and crumble the fried wonton on top.
I like it with a little sriracha and sweet chili sauce on top.

name: Egg White Royal Icing
description: A egg white royal icing recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Sift together confectioners' sugar and cream of tartar in a large bowl.
Beat in egg whites with an electric mixer until mixture is thick enough to hold its shape, about 5 minutes.

* This recipe contains raw egg. We recommend that young children, older adults, and people who are pregnant or immunocompromised do not consume raw egg. Learn more about egg safety from our article, How to Make Your Eggs Safe.
notes: This recipe contains raw egg. We recommend that young children, older adults, and people who are pregnant or immunocompromised do not consume raw egg. Learn more about egg safety from our article, How to Make Your Eggs Safe. Conference Cinnamon Rolls** Recipe by Tasty tasty.co Servings: 8 Ingredients DOUGH: 2 cups warm milk ½ cup vegan butter, melted ¼ cup organic sugar 1 packet active dry yeast 5 ½ cups flour, divided 1 teaspoon salt FILLING: ¾ cup vegan butter ¾ cup sugar 2 tablespoons ground cinnamon ICING: 1 cup powdered sugar 2 tablespoons almond milk ½ teaspoon vanilla extract Steps 1.  Oil spray a baking dish. 2.  In a mixing bowl, whisk together the almond milk, yeast, and sugar. Let sit for 7 minutes until bubbly. 3.  Add 3 cups flour and 1 teaspoon of salt to the milk mixture and mix for a few minutes. 4.  Add the remaining flour until the dough comes away from the sides of the bowl and is just slightly sticky. 5.  Cover the bowl with a towel or plastic wrap and set in a warm place to rise for 1 hour or until doubled. 6.  Turn out onto a well-floured surface. 7.  Roll the dough out into a large rectangle, about ½-inch (1 cm) thick. Fix corners to make sure they are sharp and even. 8.  Spread the softened vegan butter evenly over the dough. 9.  Sprinkle evenly with sugar and cinnamon. 10. Roll up the dough, forming a log, and pinch the seam closed. Place seam-side down. 11. Cut the log in half, then divide each half into 7 evenly sized pieces. About 1½ inches (8 cm) thick each. 12. Place 7 cinnamon rolls in each cake pan, one in the center, six around the sides. Cover with plastic wrap and place in a warm place to rise for 30 minutes. 13. To prepare the frosting. In a medium-size mixing bowl, whisk together powdered sugar, almond milk, and vanilla until smooth. 14. Remove plastic wrap. Bake the cinnamon rolls in a preheated oven at 350˚F (180˚C) for 25-30 minutes, until golden brown. 15. While still warm, drizzle evenly with frosting.

name: Eggles Nog
description: A eggles nog recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: cooked white sweet potatoes (We like Japanese sweet potato)

directions: Blend in high speed blender

name: Energy Bites
description: A energy bites recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: semisweet chocolate chips (or vegan chocolate chips)

directions: Stir everything together.  Stir all ingredients together in a large mixing bowl until thoroughly combined.
Chill. Cover the mixing bowl and chill in the refrigerator for 1-2 hours, or until the mixture is chilled.  (This will help the mixture stick together more easily.)
Roll into balls.  Roll the mixture into 1-inch balls.
Serve.  Then enjoy immediately!  Or refrigerate in a sealed container for up to 1 week, or freeze for up to 3 months.

name: Everything Breakfast Loaf
description: A everything breakfast loaf recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Preheat oven to 375°. Grease a 9" x 5" loaf pan.
In a large bowl, whisk together dry ingredients.
In a small bowl, stir together wet ingredients
Add contents small bowl to large. Stir until thoroughly mixed. Fold in spinach, carrot, raisins and berries.
Transfer batter to loaf pan. Bake for 45 minutes.
Let cool completely before removing from pan and slicing.
notes: Flour Note: Measure the 2 cups of flour, and then remove about 3-4 tbsp from the amount. Muffin Swap: If you want to make into muffins, fill 12 muffin cups (lined with parchment liners) and bake for 25 minutes.

name: Falafel
description: A falafel recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: If using authentic recipe:(One day in advance) Place the dried chickpeas and baking soda in a large bowl filled with water to cover the chickpeas by at least 2 inches. Soak overnight for 18 hours until slightly soft.
Add 1 can chickpeas, herbs, garlic and spices to the high speed blender. Blend until smooth.
Use a stand mixer and potato masher to coarsely mash the rest (2 cans) of the chickpeas.
Add the blended mixture into the mixing bowl, along with the minced onion.
Transfer the falafel mixture to a container and cover tightly. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour or (up to one whole night) until ready to cook.
Scoop tablespoonfuls of the falafel mixture and form into patties (1/2 inch in thickness each). It helps to have wet hands as you form the patties.
Roll in bread crumbs
Bake at 375 degrees on a greased cookie sheet for 25 minutes, or until golden brown.
Serve with tabouli salad, pita bread, or naan, hummus, or thousand island dressing.

name: February 2025 Membership Recipes
description: A february 2025 membership recipes recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Preheat the oven to 375°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a food processor, pulse the chickpeas until slightly mashed (leave some texture).
Add the cooked broccoli and pulse a few more times to incorporate.
Transfer to a bowl and mix in the oats, flaxseeds, cheese sauce, nutritional yeast, garlic powder, onion powder, turmeric, black pepper, lemon juice, and tahini. Stir well.
Shape into 12 patties, about ½-inch thick, and place them on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, flipping halfway, until golden brown and firm.
Let cool slightly before serving.

name: Fiesta Bean Salad
description: A fiesta bean salad recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Add all of the salad ingredients into a large serving bowl and let rest
In a small bowl mix the ranch dressing and barbecue sauce
Toss into the salad enough dressing to lightly coat the lettuce
Serve with chips, or by itself for a hearty fresh lunch. Add rice and serve for dinner as well.

name: Firm & Chewy Gingerbread Cookies
description: A firm & chewy gingerbread cookies recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Combine flax meal with the hot aquafaba or water and whisk smooth, add the vanilla extract
let it stand for about 5 minutes to thicken to a paste
Sift the flour with the cocoa powder, baking soda and all of the spices and the salt and pepper, set aside.
Cream the vegan butter with the brown sugar until light and fluffy about 4-5 minutes,
Add the egg replacer mixture and then mix well, scrape the bottom and sides of the bowl for an even mix
Add molasses to the creamed butter mixture and mix well
Add the sifted flour mixture all at once, mix until it is all incorporated evenly.
Turn out the entire dough onto a large piece of plastic wrap.
Wrap the dough tightly and press into a disc.
Refrigerate for at least 3 hours or overnight before rolling. *see notes above the recipe

Once out of the fridge you must re-roll this dough. It may seem dry and crumbly this is normal, you must mash it all together and knead it back together, then RE-roll on a floured work surface until it is pliable.
Cut your shapes, and place on a parchment lined sheet pan.
Preheat the oven to 350° F, you will bake for approximately 18-22 minutes or until light golden brown.
The bake time depends on how big & how thick your cookies are, use your best judgement
Pecan Bars
noracooks.com
Ingredients
* Shortbread Crust:
* 2 cups all purpose flour
* 1/2 cup granulated sugar
* 1/4 teaspoon salt
* 3/4 cup vegan butter, cold
* Pecan Topping:
* 1 1/2 cups brown sugar
* 2/3 cup brown rice, or corn syrup
* 3 tablespoons non-dairy milk
* 3 tablespoons melted vegan butter
* 3 tablespoons cornstarch
* 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract
* 2 cups coarsely chopped pecans
* optional: coarse salt, for sprinkling on top
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and line a 9 x 13 inch pan with parchment paper.

Prepare the crust: In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar and salt. Cut in the vegan butter with a pastry cutter, or two knives. The mixture will look like fine crumbs. Place in the prepared pan and press down evenly with your hands to form the crust. Bake for 10 minutes, then remove from oven and set aside while you make the topping.

Make the topping: In the same large bowl you made the crust in, stir together the brown sugar, brown rice syrup, non-dairy milk, melted vegan butter, cornstarch and vanilla until well combined and smooth. Fold in the pecans, then pour over the crust. Use a spatula to spread it out as evenly as possible.

Bake in the oven for 25-30 minutes, until the pecan topping is bubbling. Remove from the oven, and let cool at room temperature for 30 minutes, then place in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours to set.

Carefully lift the parchment paper with the bars out of the pan and slice into bars with a large sharp knife. I like to cut off the edges as well because they get very hard. Store leftover bars in the refrigerator for 5-6 days.

name: Flax Wraps
description: A flax wraps recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: In a saucepan, combine the ground flaxseed, onion powder, garlic
powder, and water. Stir well to mix. Turn on the heat and bring the
mixture to a gentle simmer.
Once the water is hot, turn off the heat and stir immediately. Mix until
the flaxseed meal absorbs all the water and forms a dough.
Transfer the dough to a non-stick surface, such as a silicone mat or
parchment paper, and let it cool until it is comfortable to handle.
Divide the cooled dough into 4 equal portions. Roll each portion
between two sheets of parchment paper to prevent sticking. Roll to a
thickness of about 1/16 inch and a diameter of approximately 8
Preheat a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Cook each wrap one at a
time, placing it in the pan for 1 minute on the first side, then flipping
and cooking for an additional minute.
Store in a refrigerator for up to one week.
THE J A R O U D I FA M I LY

name: French Bread
description: A french bread recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)

directions: Grease a large baking sheet and sprinkle with cornmeal. Set aside.

Combine 2 cups flour, yeast, and salt in the bowl of a stand mixer. Stir in 2 cups warm water; beat with the dough hook attachment until blended. Continue adding remaining flour, a little at a time, until incorporated.
Knead dough on a lightly floured surface until smooth and elastic, 8 to 10 minutes. Shape into a ball, place in a greased bowl, and turn once.
Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size, about 1 hour.
Punch dough down and divide in half.
Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Cover and let rest for 10 minutes.
Roll each half into a large rectangle. Roll up, starting from a long side. Moisten edge with water and seal. Taper ends.
Place loaves, seam-side down, on the prepared baking sheet.
Lightly beat egg white with 1 tablespoon water and brush over loaves.
Cover with a damp cloth and let rise until nearly doubled, 35 to 40 minutes. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Use a sharp knife to make 3 or 4 diagonal cuts, about 1/4-inch deep, across top of each loaf.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes.
Brush loaves with egg white mixture.

Continue baking until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center reads 190 degrees F (88 degrees C) or loaves sound hollow when tapped, 15 to 20 minutes more. If necessary, cover loosely with foil to prevent over-browning.
Remove loaves from the baking sheet and cool on a wire rack.

name: French Fry Burrito Bowl
description: A french fry burrito bowl recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: large Yukon gold potato, cut into 16 wedges (12 oz.)

directions: Preheat oven to 450°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Place potato wedges in a steamer basket in a large saucepan. Add water to saucepan to just below basket. Bring to boiling. Steam, covered, 15 minutes or until tender.
Transfer potatoes to a bowl. Add taco seasoning; toss to coat. Spread wedges in an even layer on the prepared baking sheet. Bake about 20 minutes or until potatoes are crispy around the edges.

For the Salsa Fresca, combine tomato, onion, lemon juice, ground cumin, and garlic powder in a blender. Blend to a thick sauce. Add fresh cilantro. Season to taste with sea salt and crushed red pepper.
To assemble, divide the potatoes, romaine, beans, rice, and corn among bowls and drizzle with some of the Salsa Fresca and desired toppings.

name: French onion soup
description: A french onion soup recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Slice the onions very thinly (Mandaline)
In a large pot add the butter and heat on medium heat
Add the onions and saute for 5 minutes
Add the sugar, salt and pepper and saute, stirring periodically, until the onions are brown, adding a splash of water if they begin to stick too much to the pan
Add the flour and stir to cook for 1 minute
Add 2 cups of the broth and whisk everything together
Add the rest of the broth and simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally
Serve with crusty french bread.

name: French Toast
description: A french toast recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Heat griddle to 400 degrees
Blend all ingredients (except bread) in blender until incorporated
Pour batter into a 8x8 glass casserole dish and let sit for 10 minutes
Dip bread in batter quickly and cook on oiled griddle.
Flip when browned and can be flipped easily

name: French Toast Casserole
description: A french toast casserole recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: (480 mls) canned coconut milk , light or regular full fat
(100 grams) sugar , any type - I like brown for extra flavor (Plus a little for sprinkling)
x 12 oz (340 gram) pack silken or soft tofu
large loaf about (14 - 16 oz or 396-454 grams) stale crusty white bread , see my tip in the post if you only have fresh bread)
handful chopped pecans or walnuts , for sprinkling (optional)

directions: Add the coconut milk, sugar, silken/soft tofu (drained if packed in water), cornstarch, cinnamon, vanilla, salt, optional turmeric, and vegan butter to a blender. Blend until smooth.
Cut the loaf of bread into 1 inch cubes and place in an ovenproof casserole dish that holds at least 2 quarts/2 litres. It should measures about 8 x 12 inches or 9 x 13 inches.

Pour the "custard' all over the bread. Press down with a clean hand all over so the cubes suck up some custard then leave to soak for at least 30 minutes, or cover tightly and put in the fridge overnight.
Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °). Scatter the French Toast Casserole with a generous handful of sugar and some chopped pecans or walnuts. (Omit for nut-free).
Bake uncovered for 35 to 40 minutes or until the top is golden and toasty. Remove the casserole from the oven and let it rest for 10 to 15 minutes before serving.

name: Fruit Slushies
description: A fruit slushies recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Fill your high speed blender 75% full with frozen fruit
Let thaw for 10 minutes
Add the rest of the ingredients and blend on high speed, using the tamper until blended smooth.
Enjoy right away, or freeze into popsicles for later.

name: G R E E N W E L L N E S S S H O T S
description: A g r e e n w e l l n e s s s h o t s recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Wash all produce thoroughly.
Add all ingredients to a high-speed blender.
Pour the blended mixture through a nut milk bag or fine
mesh strainer into a bowl, pressing to extract as much
liquid as possible.
Pour the juice into a jar or bottle. Shake well before
Store in the refrigerator for up to 7 days.
THE J A R O U D I FA M I LY

name: Garlic Smashed Potatoes
description: A garlic smashed potatoes recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

directions: Cook potatoes until almost soft in the instant pot for 7 minutes on a trivet over 1 cup of water.
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. while the potatoes cool slightly.
Lightly oil a baking sheet with nonstick spray.

Place potatoes onto the prepared baking sheet. Using a flat dry measuring cup or glass, carefully smash the potatoes until flattened but still in one piece. Top with olive oil, or spray, garlic and thyme.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until golden brown and crisp.
Serve immediately.

name: General Tso's Chkn
description: A general tso's chkn recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Preheat oven to 450F. Take your flour and water and mix until smooth. The mixture should be about the consistency of pancake batter.
Next dip your cauliflower one by one in the flour batter and tap off the excess. Then dip into bread crumbs until evenly coated. Continue this process until all the cauliflower is covered.
Place all the cauliflower bites on a sheet of parchment paper or non stick baking pan and bake at 450F for 30 minutes.
While the cauliflower is baking we can make the sauce. Prep and measure all of your sauce ingredients and then mix well together in a bowl and set aside.

Take the cauliflower out of the oven and dip them one by one in the General Tso’s sauce and place back on the baking tray. Do this process until all the cauliflower are covered in the sauce. Place back in oven for 15 minutes on 450F.
Serve over rice with vegetables and garnish with sesame seeds and a extra drizzle of sauce on top.
* For a more filling meal use tofu chunks instead of cauliflower
Tofu Pineapple Curry
frommybowl.com
Ingredients
* 1 tablespoon coconut oil
* 1/21/2” knob of ginger, finely grated
* 3– 4 tablespoons Thai red curry paste
* 1 3/4 cup fresh cubed pineapple (or sub canned)
* 1 14 ounce (403 mL) can full-fat coconut milk
* 1/2 cup (120 ml) water
* 2 teaspoons coconut sugar
* 1 teaspoon salt, plus more to taste
* 1 red bell pepper, chopped
* 2 carrots, sliced
* 5 ounces (142 g) canned bamboo shoots, rinsed well
* 1 16 oz (460 g) block super firm tofu, cubed
* 2 teaspoons arrowroot powder or cornstarch ( optional )
* Juice of 1/2 lime (about 1 tablespoon)
* Cooked jasmine rice, for serving ( optional )
* Fresh Cilantro, chopped, chopped, for serving ( optional )

Aromatics: Melt the coconut oil in a large sauté pan or pot over medium high heat. Once warm, add the red curry paste and ginger and fry for 60 to 90 seconds. Then, add in the fresh pineapple and sauté for an additional 3 to 5 minutes, stirring only occasionally to help caramelize it.

Make the Curry: Pour in the coconut milk, water, sugar, and salt. Use a spoon to mix well, until the curry paste has completely dissolved. Then, add in the bell pepper, carrots, bamboo shoots, and tofu.

Simmer: Cover the pan, raise the heat to high, and bring the mixture to a simmer. Once bubbling, uncover the pan and reduce the heat to medium; simmer for 15 minutes, or until the carrots are tender, stirring occasionally.
Thicken the Curry (optional): If you would like a thicker curry, dissolve the arrowroot powder in 1 tablespoon of water, then add to the curry and stir well; this will help to create a thicker sauce.
Garnish & Serve: Remove the curry from the heat and add in the lime juice; serve warm over rice and top with cilantro. Leftovers will keep in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.
Black Bean Soup
downshiftology.com
Ingredients
* 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
* 1 large red onion, chopped
* 1 large carrot, peeled and diced
* 2 celery ribs, diced
* 1 jalapeno pepper, deseeded and diced
* 4 garlic cloves, minced
* 2 teaspoons ground cumin
* 1 teaspoon dried oregano
* 1 teaspoon ground coriander
* 1 teaspoon kosher salt
* ⅛ teaspoon cayenne pepper
* 3 (15-ounce) cans low-sodium black beans, drained and rinsed
* 3 cups low-sodium vegetable or chicken broth, or more??
* 1 to 2 tablespoons fresh lime juice
* Optional toppings: fresh cilantro, red onion, avocado, or sour cream. Plus extra lime wedges for serving.
Heat the oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the onion, carrot, celery, and jalapeno pepper, and cook for 4 to 5 minutes, or until softened.
Add the garlic, cumin, oregano, coriander, cayenne pepper, and salt, and stir together for another minute, until fragrant.
Add the black beans and chicken broth, stir, and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for 15 minutes.

Using an immersion blender, puree the soup a few times to have a mix of creamy and chunky textures. Alternatively, you can scoop out a cup or two of soup, blend it in a standard blender until smooth, and then stir it back into the pot. Then, stir in the lime juice.
Ladle the soup into individual bowls and garnish with your favorite toppings.
* Each serving is about 2 cups.

name: Giant Pretzels
description: A giant pretzels recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: white sugar (sub maple syrup or agave if preferred)
melted vegan butter (plus more for greasing the bowl)

directions: To make the pretzels:
In a large bowl whisk together the sugar and yeast. Then add in the warm water and mix. Let sit for 10 minutes.

Add half the flour and melted vegan butter to the yeast mixture and mix until gluten forms. Add the rest of the flour slowly until it comes together as a bread dough. Let rise somewhere warm for 30 min.-1 hour until doubled in size.
To form the pretzels:
Once the dough has doubled in size, you can punch it down and remove it from the bowl. Cut into 8 even pieces. Take one piece and roll into a long rope about 17" (43cm) long.
To form a pretzel shape: twist the ends of the rope together...
Then fold the twisted ends down onto the middle of the rope to form a pretzel shape. Repeat with the remaining pieces of dough to make 8 pretzels.
To cook the pretzels:
Preheat your oven to 400F (200c). Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.

Boil the water and baking soda. Place a pretzel on a slotted spatula then dip it into the baking soda bath for 5 seconds. Now place the dipped pretzel on the prepared baking tray and sprinkle with rock salt. Repeat with the remaining pretzels.
Bake the pretzels for 12 - 15 minutes until the are dark and golden. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.

name: Gingerbread Cookies
description: A gingerbread cookies recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Make a flax egg by combining your ground flax with 2 1/2 tbsp of water and setting it aside.
Add everything except your flour to a stand mixer and turn it on and let it all blend up and cream together. Let it go until it’s all a beautiful and uniformed dark brown.
Slowly add in your flour and scrape down the sides of your mixer as you do so. Keep going until you’ve used all of your flour (but not your Brown Rice flour! It’s not part of the dough!
Once your dough is formed pack it into a ball and wrap it in plastic-wrap and chill it in your fridge for at least an hour or longer.
Preheat your oven to 350 F and prep your baking sheets with parchment or silicone sheets.
Sprinkle your work area with brown rice flour and roll out the dough until it’s about 1/8-1/4 inch thick. Cut into whatever shapes you want and put them onto your baking sheets.
Keep re-rolling your dough and cutting shapes until you run out!
Bake for 8-10 minutes, depending on how thin you rolled the dough, and let them rest for 2-3 minutes before removing from the pan to rest on a baking rack.
Once cooled eat them as-is or decorate them with icing and candies of your choice!

name: Gingerbread Loaf
description: A gingerbread loaf recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: Whole Wheat Flour (or mix of Gluten-Free 1:1 and Oat Flour)

directions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Prepare a 9×5-inch loaf pan. Set aside. In a small bowl add your ground flax and 2 1/2 tbsp of water. Mix and let sit. You’re making a flax egg!
In a medium bowl, whisk the flour, baking soda, ginger, cinnamon, cloves, salt and pepper together until combined. Set aside.
In a separate bowl or dish, whisk the molasses and hot water together. Super easy, right?
Take that flax egg and pour it into a larger bowl and add the apple sauce and mix together. Add in the coconut sugar and vanilla and mix together until well combined.
Go back and forth between adding the dry mix and the water/molasses mix to the other wet ingredients until everything is mixed together. Don’t overmix! It’s going to be a thin batter - its okay!

Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake for around 60 minutes or more until the gingerbread loaf is baked through. It’s a moist loaf. All ovens are different and your loaf could take a little more or less time. To test for doneness, insert a toothpick into the center of the gingerbread loaf. If it comes out clean with only a couple moist (not wet) crumbs, it is done. Allow to cool completely in the pan set on a wire rack before removing from pan.
Orange Icing
Whisk the confectioners’ sugar and orange juice together. Drizzle over cooled loaf.
Chocolate Cream Cheese Cake
By: The Jaroudi Family
Ingredients:
Cake Batter
1 flax egg (1 tbsp flax meal mixed with 3 tbsp water)
3⁄4 cup oat flour [120 g]
3⁄4 cup whole wheat flour (or buckwheat flour for gluten-free) [120 g]
1⁄4 cup cacao or cocoa powder (27 g)
1 tsp baking soda
1 tsp baking powder
1⁄2 cup date paste (158 g)
1⁄2 cup applesauce (110 g)
1 cup hot beverage (Korma date coffee, coffee, or tea) [236 mL]
1⁄2 cup plant milk mixed with 1⁄2 tsp apple cider vinegar (“buttermilk”) (134 mL)
1⁄2 tsp vanilla powder
1⁄2 tsp white miso paste
Cream Cheese Filling
1 cup raw cashews [140 g]
1 cup white beans, drained and rinsed [170 g]
6 pitted dates [120 g]
2 tsp vanilla powder
¾ cup plant milk [177 mL]
Dark chocolate chips
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Mix the dry cake batter ingredients in a large bowl.
Add the flax egg, hot beverage, applesauce, date paste, plant buttermilk mixture, vanilla, and miso.
Mix the cream cheese filling except the chocolate chips until smooth in a high-speed blender. Move the filling to a bowl and fold in dark chocolate chips.
Add half of the cake batter to a 9-inch Bundt pan.
Layer on top with the cream cheese filling.
Add the remaining cake batter over top of the cream cheese filling.
Bake for 50-60 minutes.
Let the Bundt pan cool completely before removing it.
This cake should be served cold straight from the refrigerator.
Top with any WFPB icing of choice and fresh fruit.

name: Golden Curry Lentil Soup
description: A golden curry lentil soup recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: water (or sub half the amount in oil)
uncooked rinsed red or golden lentils

directions: Heat a large rimmed skillet or pot over medium heat. Once hot, add water (or oil) and shallot. Sauté for 3 minutes, stirring frequently, until softened and slightly browned.
Add garlic, ginger, and serrano pepper and sauté for another 2-3 minutes. Then add carrots and a pinch of salt and stir. Cook for 1-2 minutes more, stirring occasionally.

Add vegetable broth and coconut milk and increase heat to medium high. Bring to a low boil. Then add lentils and stir. Once the mixture comes back to a low bubble, reduce heat to low or until you achieve a gentle simmer.
Add coconut aminos and curry powder and stir once more. Simmer the soup uncovered, stirring occasionally, for 12-16 minutes or until the carrots and lentils are tender.
Divide between serving bowls and garnish with fresh cilantro and lemon juice or a little fresh coconut milk or cream (optional).
Serve over rice, or with Naan

name: Grandma’s Caramel Corn Popcorn Balls
description: A grandma’s caramel corn popcorn balls recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: giant bowls of plain popped popcorn

name: Grandma’s Fudge
description: A grandma’s fudge recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: In a large pot add sugar, butter and milk and bring to a rapid boil for 6 minutes.
Add marshmallows, chocolate chips, vanilla, and any other nuts, or flavorings you desire.
Pour into a buttered 8x8 inch casserole dish and let cool before cutting into squares.

name: Grandma’s Penuche Boston Cream
description: A grandma’s penuche boston cream recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: In a large pot add 4 cups sugar, karo, and milk.
Low boil on low heat and stir constantly until the mixture reaches 240 degrees (this will take a while)
Meanwhile, cook the 1 cup of sugar and water in a small sauce pan over low heat until it comes to a boil, stirring until all of the sugar is dissolved.
Once boiling, turn up the heat and DO NOT STIR.
Place a candy thermometer and let the sugar caramelize until amber colored, not letting the temperature exceed 375 degrees.
Add the caramelized sugar to the large pot and stir to incorporate.
Pour into stand mixer and let mix for 5 minutes.
Add vanilla and nuts if using and pour into a buttered 8x8 inch casserole dish.
Let cool before cutting into squares.

name: Grandma’s Texas Sheet Cake
description: A grandma’s texas sheet cake recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: In a mixing bowl sift the sugar, flour, and baking soda together and set aside
In a saucepan heat together the butter, crisco, water, and cocoa and bring to a rapid boil.
Pour hot mixture over the flour mixture and mix slightly.
Add the eggs and buttermilk and mix well.
Bake in a greased cookie sheet at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.
While the cake bakes, In same saucepan heat butter, milk, and cocoa to a boil.
Remove from heat and add in powdered sugar, vanilla, and nuts if using.
Wisk until smooth
Pour the icing over the cake as soon as it gets out of the oven and gently smooth it out.

name: Green Bean Mushroom Casserole
description: A green bean mushroom casserole recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: cornstarch (or arrowroot powder) mixed with 3 Tbsp water for thickening
soy curls, rehydrated and sliced lengthwise or 1 cup thinly sliced onions

directions: ) Preheat oven to 350°F.
) Prepare the green beans by steaming them for 5-7 minutes or until they’re tender-crisp. Drain and set
) In a large skillet, sauté the mushrooms, onions, and garlic with a splash of water over medium heat until
softened.
) Add the plant milk, white miso paste, and nutritional yeast to the skillet. Stir well, bringing to a gentle
) Add the cornstarch mixture slowly, stirring continuously, until the sauce thickens, about 3 minutes.
Adjust with black pepper to taste.
) 7.) 8.) Combine the sauce with the green beans in a large mixing bowl, coating evenly.
Transfer to a 8x8 casserole dish and spread evenly.
Sprinkle your chosen topping over the casserole. Bake for 20-25 minutes until everything is heated
Classic Thanksgiving Dressing
By: The Jaroudi Family
Ingredients:
1 loaf whole-grain, day-old bread, cubed (about 8 cups)
3 cups vegetable broth
1 large onion, finely diced
6 celery stalks, diced
4 carrots, diced
4 garlic cloves, minced
2 Tbsp white miso paste
2 Tbsp poultry seasoning
1 Tbsp apple cider vinegar
1 tsp ground black pepper
1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
) 2.) 3.) 4.) 5.) Preheat the oven to 350°F. Spread the bread cubes on a baking sheet in a single layer. Bake for about 10
minutes or until they’re slightly toasted. Set aside to cool.
Add the onions, celery, carrots, and garlic to a large skillet over medium heat. Sauté, add a small water
splash to prevent sticking until the vegetables are tender.
In a small bowl, combine the white miso paste, poultry seasoning, black pepper, apple cider vinegar, and
a small amount of vegetable broth. Whisk until the miso is dissolved.
Add the bread cubes, sautéed vegetables, parsley, and miso mixture in a large bowl. Slowly pour the
remaining vegetable broth over the bread cubes, stirring gently until the bread absorbs the broth and the
mixture is moist but not soggy. Adjust the amount of broth if needed.
Transfer the mixture to your 9x13 casserole pan, spreading it evenly. Cover and bake for 25 minutes.
Remove cover and bake for 15-20 minutes, until the top is golden.
Baked Sweet Potato Slices
By: The Jaroudi Family
Ingredients:
4 medium sweet potatoes, thinly sliced
1 tsp ground Ceylon cinnamon
Gravy Sauce:
1 cup vegetable broth
1/2 cup unsweetened plant milk
1 Tbsp white miso paste
1 Tbsp nutritional yeast
1/2 tsp garlic powder
1/2 tsp onion powder
1/4 tsp ground black pepper
1 Tbsp cornstarch or arrowroot powder (for thickening)
Nut-Based "Cheese" Topping:
1 cup raw cashews
2 Tbsp nutritional yeast
2 tsp garlic powder
1 tsp lemon zest
1 Tbsp chopped fresh parsley (for garnish)
) 2.) 3.) 4.) 5.) Preheat your oven to 375°F. Layer the sliced sweet potatoes evenly in the 9-inch baking dish,
overlapping slightly if needed. Sprinkle with Ceylon cinnamon.
In a small saucepan, whisk together the vegetable broth, plant milk, miso paste, nutritional yeast, garlic
powder, onion powder, black pepper, and cornstarch. Bring to a gentle simmer.
Pour the gravy sauce evenly over the sweet potato slices. Cover the baking dish and bake for 25-30
minutes or until the sweet potatoes are tender.
Blend the cashews, nutritional yeast, lemon zest, and garlic powder in a food processor.
Remove the cover over the sweet potatoes. Return to the oven, uncovered, and bake for 10 more
) Sprinkle the nut-based “cheese” topping and fresh parsley over the dish just before serving.
Pierogi Platter
By: The Jaroudi Family
Ingredients:
* 2 cups whole-wheat pastry flour (or gluten-free flour)
* 1 Tbsp flaxseed meal mixed with 3 tbsp water (set aside for 10 minutes)
* 2/3 cup boiling water
* 2 tsp white miso paste
Holiday Filling:
* 1 cup mushrooms, finely chopped
* 1/2 cup cooked lentils, mashed
* 1 small onion, finely chopped
* 2 cloves garlic, minced
* 2 Tbsp unsweetened plant milk
* 1 Tbsp white miso paste
* 2 Tbsp nutritional yeast
* 1 tsp smoked paprika
* 1/4 tsp black pepper
* 1/4 tsp ground sage
In a medium sauté pan, add the chopped mushrooms and onions. Cook over medium heat until the
mushrooms release their moisture and the onions are soft. Add the garlic and cook for an additional
Remove from heat and add the mashed lentils, white miso paste, nutritional yeast, black pepper, smoked
paprika, ground sage, and plant milk. Mix well to combine and create a thick, savory filling.
Combine the flour, flax mixture, boiling water, and miso paste in a large bowl. Carefully mix until
combined, then knead the dough a few times until smooth.
Roll out the dough on a floured surface to
about 1/8-inch thickness. Use a drinking glass or round cutter to cut out circles, making about 18 rounds.
Place 2-3 tsp of the meat replacement filling on each dough round. Fold the dough over the filling and
press the edges to seal.
Fill a large pot with water and bring it to a boil. Working in batches, add about six pierogi at a time.
Cook until they float, then remove and set aside. Repeat until all pierogi are boiled.
Serve the pierogi warm, paired with our plant-based sour cream or a favorite dipping sauce.
Nut Date Rolls
By: The Jaroudi Family
Ingredients:
Date Nut Layer:
2 cups soft pitted dates
1 cup raw walnuts or almonds
2 tsp vanilla powder
2 tsp Ceylon cinnamon
Filling Layer:
1/2 cup raw nut/seed butter
1/4 cup date paste
1/2 cup finely shredded unsweetened coconut (optional)
2. 3. 4. 5. 6. 7. 8. Blend the dates, walnuts or almonds, vanilla powder, and cinnamon until smooth and sticky in a food
processor. The mixture should hold together when pressed.
In a small bowl, mix the raw nut/seed butter with the date paste until smooth and creamy.
Place a piece of parchment paper on a flat surface and spread the date-nut mixture evenly into a
rectangular shape about ¼ inch thick.
Spread the filling layer evenly on top of the date-nut mixture, covering it entirely but leaving about ½
inch around the edges free to help with rolling.
Carefully lift the edge of the parchment paper and begin rolling the layered mixture tightly from one end
to the other, creating a spiral or layered effect inside the roll. Use the parchment paper to help keep the
roll tight as you go.
Roll the completed log in the shredded coconut, pressing lightly to adhere the coating.
Wrap the roll in the parchment paper and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to firm up. Once chilled, slice
into even pieces to reveal the layered look.
Place each slice in a decorative paper liner to showcase the layered design.
Breakfast
Whole Wheat Bread or Rolls
For 3 loaves, x4 the recipe
Ingredients
* 1 cup warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)
* 3 tablespoons sugar
* 2 ¼ teaspoons active dry yeast
* 3 tablespoons vegetable oil
* 1 ½ teaspoons salt
* 3 cups whole wheat flour
Place water, sugar, and yeast into your stand mixer and mix for 10 seconds with the paddle attachment. Let sit for 5 minutes to bloom.
Add 2 cups of flour, oil, and salt, and mix on medium speed for 5 minutes until the batter begins to get stringy as the gluten develops.
Switch to the dough hook and mix in the remaining flour slowly until the dough releases from the edges of the bowl and does not stick to your hands.
Let rise until double around 30 minutes.
Shape into loaf pan, or rolls and let rise again around 25-30 minutes.
Bake at 325 for 30 minutes or
12-15 minutes for rolls.
4 cups warm water
¾ cup sugar
3 Tbs Yeast
¾ cup oil
2 Tbs salt
12 cups flour

name: Green Goddess Slaw
description: A green goddess slaw recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Combine the green cabbage, shredded carrots, and celery
in a large mixing bowl.
In a small bowl, whisk together the plant-based yogurt,
tahini, date paste, apple cider vinegar, Dijon mustard,
onion powder, garlic powder, and black pepper. Add water
a little at a time to achieve your desired creamy
consistency.
Pour the dressing over the slaw mixture and toss well to
Let the slaw chill in the fridge for at least 20 minutes to
allow the flavors to meld. Serve cold.
THE J A R O U D I FA M I LY
L E T T U C E W R A P B U R G E R S W I T H
H O R S E R A D I S H S A U C E
S E R V E S 6
I N G R E D I E N T S
Base Ingredients for All Patties:
1 cup cooked and cooled whole-grain
1 cup cooked lentils (green, brown, or black)
1 cup oat flour (or rolled oats)
1/2 cup finely chopped onion
2 garlic cloves, minced
1/4 teaspoon black pepper
1 flax egg (1 Tbsp flax meal + 3 Tbsp water)
Green Patties:
1 cup cooked broccoli or peas (mashed)
1/2 cup baby kale or spinach (finely chopped)
1 teaspoon ground cumin
Pink Patties:
1 cup cooked and mashed beets
214pmored dad carots
Yelow Patties:
1 cup cooked yellow split peas
1 tsp turmeric
1/2 tsp ground coriander
Large lettuce or Swiss chard leaves
Horseradish Sauce:
Preheat your oven to 375°F and line a baking sheet with
parchment paper.
In a large bowl, combine the b a s e ingredients with your
chosen color variation ingredients. Mix well until a dough-like
consistency forms.
Divide the mixture into six equal portions. Shape each portion
into a patty about 1/2 inch thick.
Place the patties on the baking sheet and bake for 20
minutes. Flip them and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes
or until firm and lightly browned
Let the patties cool slightly before serving. Enjoy them in the
lettuce wraps served with horseradish sauce.
1 Tbsp apple cider vinegar
1 tsp white miso paste
1/2 tsp black pepper
Horseradish Sauce
) Peel and finely grate fresh horseradish root if using fresh.
) In a small bowl, mix the grated horseradish with plant-based
yogurt, white miso paste, apple cider vinegar, mustard, and black
pepper. Add minced garlic if desired. Let the sauce sit in the
refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
THE J A R O U D I FA M I LY
S O S - F R E E K I M C H I
I N G R E D I E N T S
4 cups filtered water (for brine)
1 large napa cabbage (about 2-3 lbs)
1 cup shredded carrots
1/4 cup white miso paste
6 green onions (cut into 2-inch pieces)
1/2 cup daikon radish (julienned)
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 Tbsp minced fresh ginger
1 Tbsp apple cider vinegar
2-3 Tbsp Korean chili flakes or 1 Tbsp
chili paste
1/4 tsp cayenne pepper
Omit chili flakes and cayenne; use 2 tsp
paprika for color.
Cut the napa cabbage into quarters and remove the core. Chop into bite-
sized pieces. Dissolve the white miso paste in 4 cups of filtered water to
create a brine. Submerge the cabbage pieces in the brine and let sit for 4-6
hours, or until the leaves are pliable.
In a blender or food processor, combine minced ginger, garlic, apple cider
vinegar, and date paste. Blend until smooth.
For the spicy variation, add chili flakes and cayenne pepper to the paste. For
the mild variation, add paprika.
Drain the cabbage, reserving 1 cup of the brine. In a large bowl, mix the
cabbage, shredded carrots, green onions, and daikon radish with the
seasoning paste. Massage the paste into the vegetables using your hands
(wear gloves for the spicy version).
Tightly pack the kimchi mixture into a clean 64 oz glass jar, leaving about 1
inch of headspace.
Pour the reserved brine over the top if needed to ensure the vegetables are
fully submerged. Place a clean weight (like a small plate or fermentation
weight) on top to keep the kimchi submerged.
Loosely seal the jar with a lid to allow gas to escape, or use a fermentation
airlock. Leave the jar at room temperature (65-75°F) for 3-7 days, depending
on your preferred level of tanginess. Check daily to press the vegetables
down if needed.
Once fermented to your liking, seal the jar tightly and transfer it to the
refrigerator. The kimchi wil continue to develop flavor slowly and can be
stored for up to 1 month.
J A R O U D I FA M I LY

name: Green Healing Smoothie
description: A green healing smoothie recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: fresh greens like kale, or spinach

directions: Add flax seed to blender
Add spinach medium loosely to fill entire blender
Top with frozen fruit, pushing down to fit
Add enough water to cover the greens
Blend until smooth
*Any frozen fruit will do, I just prefer pineapple

name: Grilled Hamburgers
description: Classic grilled burgers with pepper jack cheese, fresh toppings, and all the good stuff. Simple, satisfying, and always a crowd pleaser.
directions: In a bowl, mix ground beef with worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Mix gently — overworking the meat makes tough burgers.
Divide into equal portions and form into patties slightly wider than your buns since they shrink on the grill. Press a small indent in the center of each patty with your thumb to prevent puffing up.
Preheat your grill to medium-high heat. Oil the grates lightly to prevent sticking.
Grill patties for 3-4 minutes without moving them — let them develop a good crust before flipping.
Flip once and grill another 3-4 minutes for medium. In the last minute lay a slice of pepper jack on each patty and close the grill lid to melt.
Toast the buns cut-side down on the grill for about 1 minute until lightly golden.
Build your burger and serve immediately.
notes: 80/20 ground beef is the sweet spot — enough fat to stay juicy on the grill without being greasy. Don't press down on the patties while cooking, that squeezes out all the juices. Pepper jack melts fast so only needs about 60 seconds with the lid closed.

name: Guacamole
description: A guacamole recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: kosher salt, plus more to taste
fresh lime juice (squeezed from 1 large lime)

directions: Roughly chop the garlic cloves. Once the garlic has been chopped, sprinkle 1/2 teaspoon of salt over it and crush the salt and garlic together by dragging the flat side of your knife over the mixture. This step should take no more than 1 to 2 minutes.
Mince the red onion and jalapeño pepper.

Slice and scoop out the avocado, then add it to a large bowl. Mash the avocado lightly with a fork, but leave it a little chunky for now. The avocado will become smoother once you mix everything together.
Add the garlic paste, red onion, jalapeño pepper, and cilantro to a large bowl.
Pour the lime juice into the bowl and fold the ingredients together, gently, until everything is mixed. Taste the guacamole and add more salt, to taste.
Cover and store:

If you don’t intend to eat the guacamole right away, press a piece of plastic wrap directly onto its surface, and cover the bowl with a lid. Keep the guacamole refrigerated for up to 3 days. The surface of the guacamole might still brown, but just scrape the top off to reveal the bright green guac below!

name: Hamburger Helper
description: A hamburger helper recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: Green Onions or Parsley for garnish

directions: * Prepare Cheese Sauce according to directions and set aside
* Prepare Taco Meat according to directions and set aside
* Prepare Pasta according to package instructions.
* Add frozen veggies to pasta water to cook with pasta once it's boiling.
* Drain pasta and veggies and return to pan
* Stir in tomatoes, taco meat, and finally the cheese sauce
* Adjust any seasoning and heat until warm and bubbly

name: Hamburgerless Helper
description: A hamburgerless helper recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Add all the ingredients to a medium sized pot, except for the pasta. Make sure to use cooked lentils, instead of dry like we did in the video. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for about 10 minutes.
In a separate pot, cook your pasta according to package directions, no salt, no oil!
Once it’s done, mix both together and enjoy.
For added oomph, pour into a pan and bake in a 400°F oven for

name: Hawaiian Haystacks
description: A hawaiian haystacks recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: large family can cream of mushroom soup

directions: In an instant pot add the brown rice
Cover the brown rice with water until it is 1 knuckle over
Cook on Multigrain setting for 18 minutes and quick release
Meanwhile, chop all of your vegetables and make the sauce
In a medium saucepan, add the cans of soup and water and whisk together, adding more water until the right thickness.
Heat just until hot, do not boil.
To assemble:
Serve the brown rice and top with the sauce and your preferred toppings.

name: Healthy Egg Nog
description: A healthy egg nog recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

name: Hearts of Palm Fish Sandwich
description: A hearts of palm fish sandwich recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: Ener-G, whisked with ½ cup water in a medium-sized bowl until frothy
vegan butter, for toasting the buns
mandolined cabbage (green or purple, or a mix)
mandolined red onion, soaked in ice cold water for at least 20 minutes, then patted dry

directions: Cook Mode Prevent your screen from going dark
* To make the tartar sauce, combine all ingredients and set aside.
* With a flat palm, gently press down on each hearts of palm until it pops and flattens. Slide a piece of nori inside the split and repeat with the rest of the hearts of palm.
* In a medium-sized bowl, combine the cornmeal, flour, garlic and onion powder, paprika and salt and pepper. Place the panko crumbs in a separate, medium-sized bowl.

* Press the hearts of palm into the cornmeal mixture, then into the Ener-G mixture, then back into the cornmeal mixture, back into the Ener-G mixture, then finish with coating evenly in the panko crumbs. (You could also probably try the VeganEgg here as well.) Give it another press with a flat palm to flatten again. Spray liberally all over with the cooking spray.

* Place into an air fryer set at 400. Air fry for 5 minutes, flip, coat again with cooking spray, and air fry the other side for 5 minutes more or until golden all over. Be sure to use plenty of cooking spray to allow it to crisp up and get a golden color and crunch.

* You can alternatively bake in a pre-heated, 425-degree oven. Bake for 10 minutes, flip, spray again, then bake for 7-10 minutes more, or until golden all over. Be sure to use plenty of cooking spray to allow it to crisp up and get a golden color and crunch.
* To toast the buns, melt half of the vegan butter in a cast iron pan over medium heat. Place the bottom buns into the pan until golden, and repeat the steps with the top buns.
* Assemble the sandwiches with desired toppings with the tartar sauce, or as fish sticks with the tartar sauce.

name: Hearty Vegetable Stew
description: A hearty vegetable stew recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Mince the carrot, celery stalk, and small onion for the roux very fine.
Saute this mixture in ¼ cup of veggie broth until the veggies are nice and soft.
Add the large chopped onion and continue cooking until softened.
It’s ok if the liquid gets a little low – the brown bits add to the flavor.
Add the mushrooms and cook on medium high until they lose their liquid.
Season with the rosemary and italian seasoning.
Add the vinegar and deglaze any brown spots in your pan. (This is the good stuff!)
After a few minutes add the rest of the broth, the tomatoes and tomato sauce.
Add all your chopped veggies and turn the heat up to boil.
Add the rest of the seasonings – but not the cornstarch.
Once it’s boiling, turn down the heat to low and add the peas.
Mix the cornstarch with a tablespoon of cold water and stir this in to thicken.
Simmer to desired consistency.
Vegan Cajun Pasta
Ingredients
For the vegan Cajun pasta:
* 1 pound penne pasta
* 1 yellow onion finely chopped
* 2 bell peppers any colour
* 8 ounce mushrooms halved or quartered
* 1.5 cups chickpeas or other white beans cooked or canned
* 2 cups kale chopped finely
For the vegan Cajun pasta sauce:
* 1 cup tomato sauce
* 1 cup vegetable broth choose a salty/flavourful variety
* 1 cup soy milk or other dairy-free milk
* 1-2 tsp Cajun seasoning
* 2 tablespoons cornstarch or arrowroot, tapioca
* 1 tsp onion powder
* ½ tsp garlic powder
* ⅓ cup nutritional yeast
* 1 Tbsp soy sauce
* Salt and pepper to taste
For garnish (optional):
* fresh cilantro or parsley
Cook your penne in a pot of generously salted water, according to the package directions for 'al dente' pasta. Drain and set it aside.
Meanwhile, combine the sauce ingredients in a small bowl or measuring cup, and set it aside.
Saute the chopped onion, mushrooms, and peppers to a sauté pan with ¼ cup of water over medium heat for 4-5 minutes, stirring often, until the veggies are tender, but do not overcook them.

Add the chickpeas and the sauce you just mixed in the previous step to the same pan. Mix well and let that simmer for 3-4 minutes to slightly thicken the sauce. (Taste the sauce and add more Cajun seasoning if needed, or some salt + pepper.)
Now turn off the heat, and add the cooked penne to the same pan, and mix to evenly coat each piece. Serve with fresh parsley or cilantro and enjoy.

name: Heather’s Yellow Bread or Rolls
description: A heather’s yellow bread or rolls recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)

directions: Place water, sugar, and yeast into your stand mixer and mix for 10 seconds with the paddle attachment. Let sit for 5 minutes to bloom.
Add 2 cups of flour, oil, and salt, and mix on medium speed for 5 minutes until the batter begins to get stringy as the gluten develops.
Switch to the dough hook and mix in the remaining flour until the dough releases from the edges of the bowl and does not stick to your hands.
Let rise until double around 30 minutes.
Punch dough down and then shape into loaves, or rolls.
Let rise again, around 30 minutes.
Bake at 350 for 30 minutes for bread and 12-15 minutes for rolls.

name: Heavenly Sweet Potato Breakfast
description: A heavenly sweet potato breakfast recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Pearce the sweet potatoes several times with a sharp knife.
Cook in the instant pot for 20 minutes, cut open and broil slightly until caramely.

Sprinkle with a tiny bit of sea salt. Next drizzle 1 tablespoon of almond butter, 1 teaspoon of chia along with banana slices and finally a sprinkle of cinnamon in each sweet potato. Serve immediately.
Healthy Granola
Ingredients:
1 Tbs Flaxseed Meal
2 Tbs Water
1 Very Ripe Banana
5 tsp Cinnamon
¼ tsp Nutmeg
1 tsp Vanilla
¼ tsp Salt
2 cups Rolled Oats
⅓ cup shredded Coconut
⅓ cup Pecans or Walnuts
½ cup Add ins like seeds
2 Tbsp Peanut Butter
2 Tbsp Maple syrup
Dirsctions:
Preheat oven to 325.
Blend all of the wet ingredients together in a blender with the spices.
In a large bowl add the oats, nuts, coconut, and seeds.
Pour wet mixture over dry and stir all together.
Spread on baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes, stirring every 10 minutes.
Carrot Cake Oatmeal
Ingredients
* 1/2 cup rolled oats
* 1 carrot shredded
* 1 cup water
* 1 tbsp walnut halves
* 1/4 cup plant milk
* 1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon pure maple syrup
* 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
* 1/4 teaspoon ground ginger
* Dash ground nutmeg, to taste
* 1/2 tsp vanilla
* dash of salt
In a large saucepan add your water, oats, carrot, vanilla and salt and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer, cover and cook about 5 minutes or until the oats have absorbed all the water.
Place in a bowl and top with walnuts, maple syrup and plant milk.
This is also good with a little shredded coconut on top or use coconut milk as the milk for extra flavor.

name: highcarbhannah.co
description: A highcarbhannah.co recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: buffalo wing sauce – we use Frank's Red Hot (it’s vegan)

directions: * Preheat oven to 400F degrees or air fryer to 350F. Chop your cauliflower in to bite size pieces. You want them to be about the size of a ping pong ball. Add your flour into a large bowl and whisk in soy milk until you get a pancake batter consistency.
* Place your bread crumbs in another large bowl. Next dip each piece of cauliflower into your flour batter, tapping off any excess (it works best using a fork) and then cover with bread crumbs.

* Place your battered pieces on parchment paper if you are using an oven and place in the oven for 10 minutes or until they start to brown and get crispy. If you are using an air fryer you can put them directly in there and cook 10 minutes.

* Once the cauliflower is cooked. Place your buffalo sauce into another bowl and dip the wings into the sauce one by one and place back in the oven for another 5 minutes. Once they are cooked they are ready to eat and dip in the delicious ranch below.

* Ranch Dressing Instructions– Place all your ingredients (minus the water) in a high speed blender. Start blending and slowly add in water until you get the consistency you want. Serve with buffalo wings.

name: Holiday Winter Salad
description: A holiday winter salad recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: small acorn squash peeled and cubed

directions: Preheat the oven to 425°F. Spread cubed squash, sweet potatoes and chickpeas on a baking sheet lined with
parchment paper. Roast for 15-30 minutes or until tender and slightly caramelized. Let cool.
In a bowl, whisk together the applesauce, tahini, white miso, date, balsamic vinegar, cinnamon,
and nutmeg. Add water, one tablespoon at a time, until you reach a creamy, pourable consistency.
Combine the salad greens, roasted squash, sweet potatoes, chickpeas, apple slices, pumpkin seeds, and
dried cranberries in a large serving bowl.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss gently to combine.
Veggie Pizza
Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen
Ingredients
* 2 (8 ounce) packages refrigerated crescent rolls
* 1 cup sour cream
* 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened
* 1 (1 ounce) package ranch seasoning mix
* 1 teaspoon dried dill weed
* ¼ teaspoon garlic salt
* 1 ½ cups chopped fresh broccoli
* ½ cup halved and thinly-sliced radishes
* 1 small onion, finely chopped
* 1 red bell pepper, chopped
* 1 carrot, grated
* 1 stalk celery, thinly sliced
Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 15x10-inch pan with nonstick cooking spray.
Press crescent roll dough into the prepared jelly roll pan to form a crust. Let stand 5 minutes. Pierce with a fork.
Bake in the preheated oven until dough is fully cooked and golden brown, about 10 minutes. Let cool completely.
Combine sour cream, cream cheese, ranch seasoning mix, dill, and garlic salt in a medium mixing bowl. Spread the cream cheese mixture on top of cooled crust.
Arrange broccoli, radish, onion, bell pepper, carrot, and celery on top of the cream cheese mixture.
Cover and let chill, 1 to 2 hours. Cut chilled pizza into 16 squares to serve.

name: Homemade Fries
description: A homemade fries recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Spray 2 cooking sheets lightly
Slice the potatoes into 8 or more wedges
Dump the wedges onto each cooking sheet and spray lightly with oil.
Sprinkle the spices over the potatoes and toss them to evenly coat
Spread the wedges evenly on the cooking sheets
Bake in the convection oven at 450 degrees for 25-35 minutes, or until golden brown and cooked through

name: Homemade Kind Bars
description: A homemade kind bars recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Line an 8 inch pan with aluminum foil leaving a couple of inches overhanging on each side.
Drizzle melted coconut oil in a large bowl, making sure to coat the bowl completely so its greasy, and mix together the nuts, puffed rice and flaxseed meal.  Set aside.

In a small saucepan, combine brown rice syrup, honey, vanilla and sea salt and bring to a boil.  Once the mixture starts boiling, continually whisk for 3 to 4 minutes, until mixture has thickened and its nice and sticky.
Pour syrup mixture immediately over nut mixture and stir to combine. Transfer into the lined pan and spread out evenly, making sure there are no gaps.

Allow mixture to cool for about 30 minutes then, using the overhanging foil, take the block of nuts out of the pan and place on a cutting board. Cut into 10 even bars and allow to cool completely before drizzling chocolate.
To make the chocolate drizzle, place the dark chocolate chips in a microwave-safe bowl and microwave in 30 second intervals, stirring each time until the chocolate is melted.
Spoon the chocolate drizzle over the bars and let sit at room temperature until the chocolate has set.
Store bars in an airtight container for up to a week or freeze to save for later.

name: Homemade Larabar
description: A homemade larabar recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: ( 8 ounces) Medjool (or Deglet Noor) dates pitted
( 8 ounces) Medjool (or Deglet Noor) dates pitted
( 8 ounces) Medjool (or Deglet Noor) dates pitted

directions: Line an 8-inch square baking pan with unbleached parchment paper, making sure the paper overhangs the pan on all sides. Set the pan aside.
FOR THE PEANUT BUTTER CHOCOLATE CHIP VERSION:
In a food processor fitted with a steel blade, process the peanuts until small crumbs form (about 20 seconds).
Add the dates, melted coconut oil, and salt, and pulse about 4 times or until the mixture forms wet clumps and holds together well when pressed in your palm.
Add the miniature chocolate chips to the mixture and mix with a spoon until the chips are evenly distributed throughout.
Transfer the entire mixture to the prepared baking pan and spread it into an even layer.
Cover the top with another sheet of parchment and press the mixture firmly into one even, compressed layer.
Place the baking pan in the refrigerator to chill for at least 30 minutes or until firm.
FOR THE CHOCOLATE COCONUT CHEW VERSION:
In a food processor fitted with a steel blade, process the almonds until small crumbs form (about 20 seconds).
Add the dates, melted coconut oil, melted chocolate, and salt, and pulse about 4 times or until the mixture forms wet clumps and holds together well when pressed in your palm.
Add the coconut flakes to the mixture and pulse quickly and briefly (about twice) until the flakes are about 1/4 of their original size.
Transfer the entire mixture to the prepared baking pan and spread it into an even layer.
Cover the top with another sheet of parchment and press the mixture firmly into one even, compressed layer.
Place the baking pan in the refrigerator to chill for at least 30 minutes or until firm.
FOR THE CHOCOLATE CHIP BROWNIE VERSION:
In a food processor fitted with a steel blade, process the almonds and walnuts until small crumbs form (about 20 seconds).
In a small bowl with the melted coconut oil, add the cocoa powder and mix until well-combined.

To the bowl of the food processor with the nut crumbs, add the oil and cocoa powder mixture, the dates, salt, and melted chocolate, and pulse about 4 times or until the mixture forms wet clumps and holds together well when pressed in your palm.
Add the chocolate chips to the mixture and pulse 2 to 3 times to break up the chips a bit and evenly distribute them throughout.
Transfer the entire mixture to the prepared baking pan and spread it into an even layer.
Cover the top with another sheet of parchment and press the mixture firmly into one even, compressed layer.
Place the baking pan in the refrigerator to chill for at least 30 minutes or until firm.
TO FINISH (FOR ALL 3 VERSIONS):
Once firm, remove the bars from the pan by the overhung parchment paper and place on a cutting board.
Slice into 12 equal rectangles with a large, sharp knife.

name: Homemade Muesli
description: A homemade muesli recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Mix all ingredients together and serve with berries, yogurt, or smoothie

name: Hummus
description: A hummus recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Drain your garbanzo beans into a bowl and save the aqua faba (liquid) from the can.
Add all of your ingredients into your blender.
Blend on high for 2 minutes. You want the hummus to be very creamy and fluffy, adding aquafaba as needed to get a creamy consistency.
Place in an air tight container and store in the fridge for up to one week.
Variations:
Add roasted red bell peppers
Jalapenos
Sesame seeds and sesame oil
Roasted Garlic

name: Ingredients
description: A ingredients recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Slice eggplant into thin rounds slightly less than 1/2 inch thick, and sprinkle each side liberally with sea salt. Arrange in a circular pattern in a colander and place in the sink to draw out the bitter taste of the eggplant.

Let rest for 15 minutes, and arrange on a clean absorbent kitchen towel. Top with another clean dish towel and lay a baking sheet on top. Place something heavy on top, such as a cast iron skillet, to thoroughly dry for at least 10 minutes.
In the meantime, preheat oven to 400 degrees F (204 C) and line a baking sheet with foil and spritz with nonstick spray. Also, if making pasta, bring water to a boil in a large saucepan.
Prepare your dipping stations by placing almond milk + cornstarch in one bowl; flour in another bowl; and bread crumbs + sea salt + oregano + vegan parmesan (or nutritional yeast) in another bowl.
Once thoroughly dry, dip eggplant slices in flour, then almond milk mixture, then breadcrumbs. Arrange on the baking sheet and pop in oven to bake for a total of 20-30 minutes.
While eggplant is browning in the oven, prepare marinara. I prefer adding my tomato sauce and spices to a serving bowl and microwaving to warm, but you could also heat it on the stove. Set aside.
Once done cooking, drain pasta and cover with a towel to keep warm. Set aside.
To serve: Plate pasta and eggplant slices and marinara in a dish as a dipping sauce. Additional vegan parmesan cheese makes an excellent topper.

name: Jambalaya Pasta
description: A jambalaya pasta recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: diced tomatoes with green chiles RO
Cajun seasoning Tony Chachere's is the best!
pasta noodles we like linguine or spaghetti

directions: Add all the ingredients EXCEPT cilantro into a large pot.
Bring to a boil, stirring often.
Once boiling, reduce heat and simmer* for about 20-25 minutes or until noodles become soft, stirring often. Add more broth if necessary.
Garnish with cilantro before serving.

name: Jamie's Cranberry Spinach Salad
description: A jamie's cranberry spinach salad recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: * Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir almonds in butter until lightly toasted. Remove from heat and let cool.
* Make dressing: Whisk together oil, sugar, cider vinegar, white wine vinegar, sesame seeds, poppy seeds, minced onion, and paprika in a medium bowl.
* Combine spinach with toasted almonds and cranberries in a large serving bowl. Pour dressing over spinach mixture; toss well.

name: Korean Egg Dumpling
description: A korean egg dumpling recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Seasoning
* ¾ Tablespoon Soy Sauce
* ¾ Tablespoon Sesame Oil
* 1 teaspoon (!) Salt
* 1 teaspoon (!) Sugar
Boil Dangmyeon Noodles
Boil Noodles for 7 minutes, or as instructed on package.

Finely mince Onion (⅓ a whole) and Carrot (pinky-length piece) into small pieces. Dice 1-2 stalks of Green Onion into thin pieces as well. Then de-seed 1 chili pepper (or 1 jalapeno), and finely mince ⅓ of it into small pieces (this ingredient is optional). Place all of the veggies into a large mixing bowl.

Strain the noodles. Cool it down under cold water. Then shake off the excess water from the noodles. Place the boiled noodles into a separate mixing bowl. Use kitchen scissors to cut the noodles into small pieces - be thorough!
Add these chopped noodles into the bowl with the other veggies. Crack in 3 eggs.
Season the egg mixture
To the bowl, add-in Soy Sauce (¾ Tablespoon), Sesame Oil (¾ Tablespoon), Sugar (1 teaspoon!), Salt (1 teaspoon!)
Give it a thorough mix - make sure everything gets mixed evenly!
Make Egg Dumplings
Place some oil onto a non-stick frying pan. Place on medium-low heat. Once the oil gets hot, carefully scoop on two spoonfuls of the mixture and make small circular piles around the pan.

Let it cook for 20-30 seconds so the bottom can set. Then use a spoon in one hand, and a spatula in another to carefully fold the eggs. Then flip the dumpling so the other side can cook through as well.
Once it cooks through on both sides, place on a plate.
Serve with steamed rice

name: Korean Pancakes with Scallions (Pajeon or Pa Jun)
description: A korean pancakes with scallions (pajeon or pa jun) recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: bunch scallions washed, with the ends trimmed and cut in half lengthwise if thick

directions: Cut off ends of scallions and slice in half lengthwise, if the scallions are thick, and in the middle if they are too long to fit in the pan.

In a large bowl, mix the flour, cornstarch, salt, garlic, and half of the egg with the ice water.  If the batter seems too thick, add a little more water (about 1 teaspoon at a time) until the batter is runny, but still slightly thick.

Heat 2 tablespoons of the oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat, then pour half of the pancake batter into the pan, swirling it into a thin pancake similar to how you would form a crepe.  Immediately arrange half of the scallions on top of the batter in a single layer.

Drizzle with half of the remaining beaten egg, then cook until the bottom is golden brown (about 3 to 4 minutes), then flip over and cook another 3 to 4 minutes, add more oil, if necessary, until the pancake is crisp and golden brown.
Repeat with remaining batter and ingredients, then serve hot with dipping sauce.
Dipping Sauce:
Combine all of the ingredients for the dipping sauce in a small bowl and whisk together.

name: Lemon Meringue Pie
description: A lemon meringue pie recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Gather all ingredients and preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (162 degrees C).

To make the lemon filling: Whisk 1 cup sugar, flour, cornstarch, and salt together in a medium saucepan; stir in water, lemon juice, and lemon zest. Cook over medium-high heat, stirring frequently, until mixture comes to a boil. Stir in butter.
Place egg yolks in a small bowl and gradually whisk in 1/2 cup of hot sugar mixture.
Whisk egg yolk mixture back into remaining sugar mixture. Bring to a boil and continue to cook while stirring constantly until thick. Remove from heat; pour filling into baked pastry shell.
To make the meringue topping: Beat egg whites in a glass, metal, or ceramic bowl with an electric mixer until foamy. Gradually add sugar, continuing to beat until stiff peaks form.
Spread meringue over pie filling, sealing the edges at the crust.
Bake in preheated oven until meringue is golden brown, about 20 to 25 minutes.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Lentil Loaf Casserole with Mashed Potato Topping
description: A lentil loaf casserole with mashed potato topping recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Mashed Potato Topping:
* 5 large potatoes, peeled and cubed
* 3/4 cup unsweetened plant milk
* 2 Tbsp nutritional yeast
* 2 Tbsp white miso paste
* Black pepper to taste
* 2 green onions, sliced
In a pot, add lentils and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer and cook for 25-30
minutes until lentils are soft. Drain any excess water.
Preheat the oven to 375°F. Add the onion, garlic, carrot, celery, and mushrooms to a nonstick skillet.
Sauté, adding a splash of water as needed until softened.
In a large bowl, combine cooked lentils, sautéed vegetables, oats, ground flaxseed, tomato paste, white miso paste, thyme, rosemary, and black pepper. Stir until well combined.
Lightly spread the lentil mixture evenly into the bottom of a 9x13-inch casserole pan.
Boil the potatoes in a pot of water until tender, about 15-20 minutes. Drain, then mash the potatoes with
plant milk, nutritional yeast, white miso paste, and pepper.
Spread the mashed potatoes evenly over the lentil mixture in the casserole pan. Use a fork to create a
textured top for a crispier finish if desired. OR use a pastry bag to create beautiful swirly dollops. Place
the casserole in the preheated oven and bake for 30 minutes, until the top is lightly golden and firm.
Top with sliced raw green onion

name: Lentil Sloppy Joes
description: A lentil sloppy joes recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Place 1 cup of the water or stock in a large pot.
Add the onions and bell pepper and cook, stirring occasionally until onions soften slightly, about 5 minutes.

Add the chili powder and mix in well. Add the remaining liquid, lentils, tomatoes, and the rest of the seasonings. Mix well, bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover and cook over low heat for one hour, stirring occasionally.
Serve on whole-wheat buns, or fresh baked bread, with the trimmings of your choice.

name: Lentil Vegetable Soup
description: A lentil vegetable soup recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: * Gather the ingredients.
* Heat oil in a large soup pot over medium heat. Add onions, carrots, and celery; cook and stir until onion is tender, 3 to 5 minutes.
* Stir in garlic, bay leaf, oregano, and basil; cook for 2 minutes.
* Stir in lentils, and add water and tomatoes. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and let simmer until lentils are tender, about 40 minutes.
* When ready to serve, stir in spinach and cook until it wilts.
* Stir in vinegar and season with salt and pepper; taste and adjust as needed.
* Serve hot and enjoy!

name: Luxurious Lasagna
description: A luxurious lasagna recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Boil Lasagna noodles until al dente.
Mix all of the sauce ingredients and set aside
Mix all of the Ricotta ingredients and set aside
While the pasta cooks make the Bechamel
Melt the butter in a saucepan
Add the flour and cook until bubbly.
Add the spices
Wisk the soy milk in slowly and cook, whisking until it thickens into a gravy consistency.
Assemble the lasagna:
Preheat your oven to 375 degrees
Place a scoop of sauce on the bottom of a 9x13 casserole dish
Follow with a layer of 3 lasagna noodles
Top noodles with 1/3 of the ricotta mixture
Top ricotta with 1/4 of the red sauce
Repeat steps until you have 4 layers
Top with the red sauce and then the bechamel
Cover with foil and bake for 40 minutes
Uncover foil and bake uncovered for 10-15 minutes more.
Let cool for 10 minutes before cutting and serving

name: Marshmallow Fondant
description: A marshmallow fondant recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.
directions: Place marshmallows and 2 tablespoons of water in a large microwave-safe bowl.
Microwave for 30 seconds on high; stir until mixed well. Continue microwaving in 30 second intervals until melted and smooth.
Place about 5 cups of the powdered sugar on top of the melted marshmallow mixture and gently fold it into the marshmallows.
Grease your hands and your counter generously with shortening. Turn marshmallow mixture onto counter and start kneading it like you would dough.
Add more confectioners' sugar as needed and re-grease your hands and the counter as needed.
If the marshmallow fondant is tearing easily, it is too dry; add water (about 1/2 tablespoon at a time) kneading it until fondant forms a firm, smooth elastic ball that will stretch without tearing.
Yield: This recipe makes about 3 pounds (48 oz) of fondant. Here is a conversion chart to help you determine how much fondant you need to cover your cake.
notes: Yield: This recipe makes about 3 pounds (48 oz) of fondant. Here is a conversion chart to help you determine how much fondant you need to cover your cake.

name: Melty Mozzarella
description: A melty mozzarella recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: + 2 teaspoons tapioca starch (also called tapioca flour)

directions: Softening the cashews:

Softening the cashews first helps them blend. If you have a high-powered blender you may be able to skip this step, but if not, this step is important to get a smooth cheese. You can either boil or soak the cashews. To boil the cashews (the fast method): add the cashews to a small pot, cover with water, and boil for about 10 minutes until the cashews are very tender. To soak the cashews: add the cashews to a bowl, and cover with water. Let soak for 4 hours or overnight until tender. Drain and rinse cashews before using.
To make the vegan mozzarella:
Add the cashews along with the 1 cup of water and all the remaining ingredients to a blender. Blend until completely smooth. It will be very watery.

Pour into a small saucepan and put over medium-high heat. Continually stir. The cheese will start forming clumps, keep stirring and it will continue clumping until the mixture turns from watery to a thicker melty cheese sauce. This takes about 5 minutes. Serve hot or allow to cool and store in an air-tight container in the fridge for 2 - 3 days. The cheese will get thicker as it cools but will stay in a melty state.

name: Meringue Powder Royal Icing
description: A meringue powder royal icing recipe from the Sevey Family Cookbook.

ingredients.name: meringue powder (not plain egg white powder)
optional for decorating: gel food coloring (I love this  food coloring kit)

directions: Watch the video of the icing above so you get an idea of what the final consistency should be.

Pour confectioners’ sugar, meringue powder, and 9 Tablespoons of water into a large bowl.
